title: Nike React Vision
description: This one's a vision of comfort.Layered textures, unique shapes and vivid colours combine in a design influenced by the exaggerated worlds found in our dreams. React foam and a soft tongue keep it smooth.

title: Nike Air Max 270
description: Drawing inspiration from the Air Max 180 and Air Max 93, the Nike Air Max 270 has crisp lines and streamlined detail that add edgy style to optimal comfort. The large Max Air unit gives you extra bounce and cushion for wherever your day takes you.

title: Nike Air VaporMax 2021 FK
description: Made from at least 40% recycled materials by weight, the Nike Air VaporMax 2021 FK is airy and easy to wear with super-stretchy, recycled Flyknit fabric, plus a soft collar that sculpts your ankle.The stitched-on Swoosh and recycled TPU heel clip add a splash of intrigue as you float down the streets on incredibly soft VaporMax cushioning.

reviews.title: Pros: comfortable Cons: May tend to wear fast
reviews.body: I personally believe that these are the best and most comfortable shoes from Nike. I have tried a number of brands and a number of styles and nothing fits better than a vapormax. The fit like a glove to your feet and provide you with that extra bounce you need to keep your day going. I play basketball and I used to wear slides to and from the game until I discovered vapormax. Now I wear vapormax to and from the game because of comfort and they also provide a stylist look. My only dislike about this shoe is that on the exterior of the shoe facing inside after a long amount of wear there is a small tear on both shoes. How this my be a one time thing. I still highly recommend these shoes and if your still not completely sold I have 13 pair of shoes in all that all fit and I wear on a regular basis and out of those 13 there are 12 that are vapormax and the other are basketball shoes. They are not all this style however all 12 are vapormax.
Comfortable & light. Fit great!

I tend to be very hard on shoes because I am very active. These shoes actually assist me because how structured they are. They are beyond comfortable and I rea

reviews.body: These shoes fit well and had very good traction for basketball. The geographic soles feel helpful when cutting cutting shifting weight quickly. The look of these shoes is more retro than I would pick out usually, but overall a good sneaker.

reviews.title: Zoom Freak 3 Shoes
reviews.body: These shoes fit pretty snuggly around my foot but felt a little long in the toe area. It has a Velcro strap that goes across the laces for extra support. This is a nice feature, especially when playing games outside. The velcro does have a down side. The side of the strap that is stitched in place, it appears the stitching wasn't finished which causes a little lip to stick out. If your fo

reviews.title: Kicks for everything
reviews.body: These shoes fit and feel fantastic. The design is great. Love that the right/left coordinate with each other rather than match. These shoes are plenty comfortable to wear all day. The only problem is I almost forgot to change shoes and started to mow the lawn in them. They cleaned up fine though are my go to shoes for most everything now. My wife has now discovered my shoes and wants to get a matching pair…which is my only complaint about the shoes (I’m not keen on matching) but don’t tell the wife.

reviews.title: Freak Out
reviews.body: The Zoom Freak 3 are very comfortable. Although the color combination could be better, the comfort makes up for it. These are not everyday wears or going out wear for me but more of a walk, stroll or activity shoe. The comfort level to me is a 10 out 10 and I would wear them for those activities that require that comfort. If I could change anything it would be the style of the strap or the entire strap itself. All in all good fit, great comfort but design to get used to.

reviews.title: Unique and Comfortable
reviews.body: The Nike Zoom Freak 3s are very stylish and the design is unique. They provided comfort to my feet after wearing all day running around. They also provide a strong grip which is useful when doing sports. I liked that the style was just a bit different. I prefer more basic style shoes but these pass the basic but with flair shoes. The purple Velcro strap is different but still goes with everything. All in all a great shoe for day to day or just for sports. You can’t go wrong either way.

reviews.title: Comfortable and supportive
reviews.body: These shoes were very comfortable and provided support for my feet for different activities including basketball and running. They seem to be durable and are made well. I'm not sure really on what I think of how they look as at first I liked the appearance but after a bit of wearing them I'm questioning if I really like how they look. Overall I feel they are a good quality shoe and are comfortable for both casual wear and when being active.

reviews.title: Giannis Freak 3
reviews.body: Definitely an awesome addition to the NBA champion league and MVP’s collection of shoes. I found these to be very stable comfortable. And as someone who has ankle problems like myself, they are very stable and keep your ankles in place at the same time allowing for easy maneuvering and movement on the court. I also like that it’s a low ankle profile to the model of the sneaker, meaning that it can be worn off the court as well as for lifestyle purposes.

reviews.title: It has a capable cap shot
reviews.body: The Greek freak zoom 3's are total grip for lane drivers. they have a capable cap shot and everything. but it is a little tight on the sides.

reviews.title: Zoom Freak shoes
reviews.body: The Nike Zoom Freak 3 basketball shoes definitely have a unique look to them with the Velcro wing strap. The shoe is pretty comfortable and can have extra support along the mid-foot and arch area by strapping down the middle support wing. The color selection is overall fairly neutral, but unique enough with the lock/key design on the shoe tongue, the purple Velcro wing, and the mismatched colors of the Nike logo on the toe area. The design is certainly visually interesting, just not my personal style. The shoes seem to run a bit small, so would recommend sizing up a 1/2 size at least. The shoes are quite comfortable, but did feel a little on the heavy side (likely due to increased support for play). I also prefer more ankle support for basketball shoes, so the low profile is less ideal. I did not care for the plastic wing along the mid foot, as it is an extra step when putting in the shoes and taking them off and it is quite bulky. Overall, good materials and quality, just not my style.

reviews.title: Sharp Looking Shoe, Good on the Courts
reviews.body: The Nike Zoom Freak 3 is a good looking shoe! The design is sleek and not clunky, which is a nice feat for a basketball shoe. There is a great deal of stability side-to-side, and the shoe fits true to size. The stylings of the lock and key on separate feet was not something that I noticed right away, but made for an interesting design choice.
Great traction on the shoe. Strap allows your foot to be locked down. Very good cushioning and premium materials. Good for indoor and outdoor.

reviews.title: Just Don’t Do It
reviews.body: This shoe is honestly an embarrassment to the Nike brand. It’s horribly tight and uncomfortable - and I have small feet. It’s unattractive, not innovative, and provides no more support than a cheap sneaker.

reviews.title: Cool Sneaks without being too Wild
reviews.body: For myself the shoe was a perfect fit! I really was satisfied with the feel during movement and while being active. The design is cool too! I like the little pop of color and how the whole shoe isn't black. I need to wear them a little more, but they become bothersome when worn all day. The sole of the shoe is so dope! I just am not sure how the sole will hold up to wear.

reviews.title: Very comfortable
reviews.body: These shoes are very comfortable. I would definitely wear them to play sports or run around with the kids. The design/style is not ideal for me though. I did not like that the shoes didn't match each other in more than one place. I know younger kids though that probably love this style. I also didn't really like the band across the top of the laces. It seemed to just add one more step in wearing the shoes. The shoes do seem durable and true to size and I will definitely wear them at home and doing other activities.

reviews.title: Excellent shoe!
reviews.body: The shoe is very sturdy and well made. The shoe is nice and snug on my feet – not too tight/narrow but also not loose. Plenty of room for my toes to be comfortable. I enjoy the black and white color scheme of the design. The purple piece is not aesthetically my preference, but it doesn’t bother me or detract from function when I’m wearing the shoes. I had no problem wearing the shoe all day. My kids loved the sensory feel of it. Did not rub or cause blisters and had great arch support.

reviews.title: Cool shoes
reviews.body: These sneakers are pretty awesome! Pretty funky (imo) but cool! The purple jelly strap along with the green and blue Nike logo on the front takes me back to the 90’s! Something I’d definitely wear back then and now. These aren’t just cool they’re also very comfortable! You can walk in them all day and not feel it at the end of the day!! I wouldn’t change anything 10/10

reviews.title: Very Comfortable Shoe
reviews.body: These shoes are the most comfortable shoes I have found.  I have flat feet and finding the right shoe can be difficult, but these have amazing soles that make it feel like walking on a cloud.  They are very cushiony which makes walking / running / jumping all comfortable.  We have a tripped planned in a month and these will be the shoes I’m taking because they are just so comfortable.

title: Nike Zoom Fly 4
description: Train hard and find your rhythm on the road.From the moment you lace up, the webbing on the upper and lacing system wrap around your foot for a secure feel from start to finish.The added flex feels highly responsive and secure with every step.A soft, breathable upper is combined with a stretchy collar for a sock-like fit for a secure, stable sensation.You've got goals to hit, lace up and fly towards a new best.

title: Air Jordan XXXVI 'First Light'
description: Since 1985, Jordan Brand has always done things that have never been seen before.Almost forty years later, Jordan continues to bring new light to the game with international athletes that are redefining the blueprint once again.Beaming with talent, it's about the shine within that makes the new faces of the game radiant on the court.Drawing inspiration from ultraviolet rays, the Air Jordan XXXVI 'First Light' celebrates the future of Jordan—the ones who will brighten the way for the next generation of global superstars all across the world.

reviews.title: Another Great Number Shoe
reviews.body: It's finally here! Wanted the 36 since those first pics leaked. Now that I have them....they were worth the wait. That Zoom strobel is terrific. That upper is so light and breathes like crazy. The outsole traction is great. The nods to the OG 6 are there, and are subtle so the don't overpower the shoe. The only *bad* thing is that they run small in the toe box. I wear a 12 but had to get a 13 to be comfortable, so keep that in mind when you order.

reviews.title: Wabble, wabble... why the wabble!
reviews.body: This nearly perfect shoe blew it when they want back to the wabble of the Jordan 31 with the forefoot being unstable due to zoom bag extending past the support of the shoe. Why?!?!? Everyone knew this sucked in the 31. Oh well, I'll wear them casually but on court? No way.
They're a good shoe

title: Jordan Delta 2 SP
description: The Jordan Delta 2 offers a fresh, fearless take on the features you want: durability, comfort and an attitude that's Jordan to the core.We updated design lines and swapped out some components, but the idea is the same as the first Delta.The 2 still has that clashing combination of supportive and space age-like materials, with lots of different textures and heavy stitching to create a look that's both adventurous and iconic.

reviews.title: Very slim/narrow tight toe area
reviews.body: Very stylish & I get compliments all the time about these Jordans. One thing about them though, is theyre very narrow in the toe area so if you dont have pointy slim toes, this is not the shoe for you!! They can be very uncomfortable when worn for more than a few hours....

title: Jordan Stay Loyal
description: Straight from our past and into the future.The Jordan Stay Loyal takes cues from the classic Air Jordan 12 to create a shoe that's fresh yet familiar.Inspired by the 12's durability, it features burly leather overlays and rubber herringbone traction that wraps up the toe, sides and heel.

title: Nike Air Max 90
description: Nothing as fly, nothing as comfortable, nothing as proven—the Nike Air Max 90 stays true to its roots with the iconic Waffle sole, stitched overlays and classic TPU accents.Fresh materials update the design while Max Air cushioning adds comfort to your journey.

title: Nike Pegasus Trail 3 GORE-TEX
description: Journey off the beaten path and into wet weather with the Nike Pegasus Trail 3 GORE-TEX.It's made with the same cushioned comfort you love, plus tough traction and improved midfoot construction for secure, neutral support.The waterproof upper helps keep you moving on rocky trails even when stormy conditions try to slow you down.Don't let the rain stop you—lace up and take on the elements.

reviews.title: Great running times in wet weather.
reviews.body: Good foot support, comfortable ride, been able to run some good times with these trainers in wet weather. Great grip, but stay away from red brick surfaces.

title: Nike Air Zoom Pegasus 38 Shield
description: Wet weather can't stop your daily running habit when you lace up your workhorse with wings.We set out to keep your feet both warm and dry in damp conditions, so we added details like a gusseted, insulated tongue and a warm upper that's finished with a weatherised coating.Tyre-inspired grip creates tough traction to help keep you moving on slick streets.

title: Nike Air Zoom Terra Kiger 7
description: Run the trail in a super-responsive running shoe.Fast and lightweight, it delivers a breathable and secure feel as you race over rocky paths.Updated traction lugs provide stability for your downhill miles.

title: Nike React Miler 2 Shield
description: Don't let the rain stop your daily running routine.We took the classic look of your favourite runner and added a warm upper with a weatherised coating.Our goal was to keep your feet dry in damp conditions, so we added details like a gusseted and insulated tongue.And with a supportive design built for maximum shock absorption, each step feels stable.Tough, tyre-inspired traction creates grip to help keep you moving on slick streets.

title: Nike Air Force 1 '07 LV8
description: Go full throttle in the Nike Air Force 1 '07 LV8.Bringing motocross-inspired details like bold branding, reflective-design accents and durable materials to the streetwear favourite, it delivers high-octane energy.

title: Nike Offline 2.0
description: Refresh and relax in the Nike Offline 2.0 Mule.Its micro-bead insole creates a subtle texture that massages your feet while the padded, bootie-like upper feels soft and airy.Rounded laces bring it into a new realm and let you personalise your fit, while the cork and rubber heel piece contrasts against the technical upper for a modern look.We think it's OK to do nothing—just do it comfortably.

title: Nike Phantom GT2 Elite AG-PRO
description: Create a shockwave on the pitch with an updated design that looks as fast as you play.The Flyknit upper has a textured pattern that's engineered to help you place your shots with pinpoint accuracy.

title: Nike SB Shane Premium
description: As the first signature shoe from technical phenomenon Shane O'Neill, the Nike SB Shane is built to perform. This premium version gives you the same performance as the original, but it's dressed up in plush leather. Its unique lacing lets you choose between lacing your shoes the traditional way or by running them through durable ghillie loops.

title: Nike Phantom GT2 Elite Dynamic Fit FG
description: Create a shockwave on the pitch with an updated design that looks as fast as you play.The Flyknit upper has a textured pattern that's engineered to help you place your shots with pinpoint accuracy.

title: Nike Air Presto Premium
description: With a sleek design that's more comfortable than your favourite T-shirt, the Nike Air Presto is made to feel good and look fast. Its stretchy sleeve creates a cosy, sock-like fit.Super-soft foam adds a spring to your step.Put it on.You'll never want to take it off.

title: Nike Air Zoom Victory Tour 2
description: Staying true to the sophistication of its predecessor, the Nike Air Zoom Victory Tour 2 brings cutting-edge innovation to a classic silhouette. The updated design pairs supple, sophisticated leather with hidden performance details, like Zoom Air and exceptional traction—so you can play at your best from tee box 1 to the 18th green.

title: Nike ZoomX Vaporfly NEXT% 2 By You
description: You know that every run counts.When you pull on the Nike Vaporfly Next% 2 By You, there's already a goal in mind.Set yourself up for success with custom performance details—like toggle laces or Waffle tread—and a look that inspires you to get out there.

title: Nike ZoomX Vaporfly NEXT% 2 By You
description: You know that every run counts.When you pull on the Nike Vaporfly Next% 2 By You, there's already a goal in mind.Set yourself up for success with custom performance details—like toggle laces or Waffle tread—and a look that inspires you to get out there.

title: Jordan Delta 2
description: The Jordan Delta 2 offers a fresh, fearless take on the features you want: durability, comfort and an attitude that's Jordan to the core.We updated design lines and swapped out some components, but the idea is the same as the first Delta.The 2 still has that clashing combination of supportive and space age-like materials, with lots of different textures and heavy stitching to create a look that's both adventurous and iconic.

reviews.title: Delta 2
reviews.body: Being new to Jordans, I was unsure how they’d fit. Comfy, true to size and happy to wear these all day! The materials feel like they’re built to last, but time will tell.

reviews.title: A shockingly, comfortable and light shoe!
reviews.body: Nice shoe! I like the different contrast of materials on the shoe. The shoe is extremely comfortable. I was shocked at how good the shoe felt. I could walk in the shoe all day.

reviews.title: Like the Style, could be more comfortable
reviews.body: I really liked the look of these shoes and they do look great on the foot. My only issue is that the react sole seem thinner and it seems to walk a little 'harder' on the foot.

reviews.title: Get a pair…a solid pair of Jordans you can wear without beating up your gems.
reviews.body: Much better than expected….comfortable, unique style, and cheap! Allow me to wear a Jordan without dipping into the stash.

reviews.title: Your feet will love these
reviews.body: First off I love the style it’s got a classic Jordan’s look with a bit of modern/street look plus the duo lace option is pretty cool you can either have them kinda hidden or regular. The color ways has a summer vibe light green hits sweet with white/black/tan, one of the most comfortable shoes I’ve ever worn it’s like your feet just melt into them very light weight with feeling of walking on air/clouds lol I gave durability average as these are only a week old but I’m sure these will last awhile

reviews.title: Super comfortable
reviews.body: Probably the most comfortable shoe I’ve ever gotten

reviews.title: Great shoe so far!
reviews.body: These shoes are great! They are super comfortable.
very comfortable shoes.. worth it
Cloud 9!!!!!

reviews.title: Looks and feels great
reviews.body: I've tried every brand of shoe out there I think, and I do have a preference towards Nike, and these not only look cool, they feel very comfortable too. I wear through shoes usually in 4-6 months with my job, but these feel very durable and seem like they will last much longer than that. I didn't think I'd like the design as much at first, but now I'm really digging it. The size feels just right, which is good, i don't like spending a lot of time shoe shopping, so that worked great for me.

reviews.title: Great for a Sneakerhead or just wearing around town!
reviews.body: I've been wearing the Nike Jordan Delta 2 shoes for about a week now, and have been impressed with the comfort of the shoe and air heel! I wear them on average 6-8 hours a day, mostly standing, and have been happy with the all-day comfort. The design is really unique- I've had several 'sneakerheads' impressed with them and asked where I was able to get a pair, but they are bright and it can be polarizing for people who want a more modest looking athletic shoe. Overall, I've been very happy with them but have to drop one star rating as the sizing runs a little on the smaller size, especially the toe box, so plan accordingly. This is a big surprise from Nike which I always feel is pretty true to size, if not large!

reviews.title: Trendy shoe
reviews.body: The husband liked the way these shoes looked out of the box and was excited to try them. They look big but fit true to size. The design was eye catching and very stylish. Good for playing ball on the court and going out.

reviews.title: Comfortable, durable, cool
reviews.body: The Nike Delta 2 is very well-built, comfortable and definitely interesting to look at. With lots of different materials and updates from the original Delta, it is trendy and functional at the same time. While the shoe looks good now, some of the components like the suede and semi transparent materials seem like they’re not going to last long.

reviews.title: Extra Leather Does Not Some Jordan’s Make
reviews.body: Unboxing these things I immediately noticed the extra bit of leather around the lace holes. This leather patch had their own lace holes in them. Very confusing. Are these for backup laces?  It’s very odd to say the least and doesn’t compliment the shoe at all.

reviews.title: Great looking shoe, and almost a great-feeling shoe
reviews.body: Love the chunky look of the shoe, and appreciate that it comes in colors that are a little more understated than many shoes on the market right now.

reviews.title: Way more comfortable than I expected!
reviews.body: From the look of the shoes they look like they have some sharp edges that may dig into the feet, but honestly I wore them for 2 minutes before it felt like I’d been rocking them for weeks.  With two kids I’m on my feet a lot and I could noticeably tell a difference when wearing these vs my other kicks.   The style wasn’t quite me at first, but it grew on me super quick and I’ve never received as many compliments on my shoes before.  They definitely stand out in a good way.  Making me rethink my entire shoe collection at this point and what style I should be focusing on.

reviews.title: MY COOL SHOES
reviews.body: These shoes are what I put on when I want to feel cool!  I received so many compliments on them. I love the loud colors and different textures of this shoe. They were also very comfortable. I was able to wear them out and about running errands and walking around all day and my feet never hurt. These shoes also made me feel taller and even though I've been wearing them almost every day since I received them,  they still look brand new!  The only thing I would change is I wish they made them in women's sizes!!  I would definitely recommend these shoes to anyone who wants a comfortable, cool looking shoe!

reviews.title: Cool and stable court shoes
reviews.body: These were my first pair of Nike Jordan shoes and I have to say I’m impressed. I like the colors and the mix of materials on the top of the shoes. Not too bold, not too plain. Both features make them unisex in my mind, which I appreciate given that I tested out a men’s size. The side to side stability is noticeable and awesome. With a weak ankle, I can’t play basketball without that kind of support and these shoes felt very stable. I also liked the back pull loop to make these easier to get on.

reviews.title: Great fit and good looking sneaker that's comfortable all day
reviews.body: The shoe fit was perfect (ran true to size) and was comfortable, even when worn all day, running after my kids at the playground and hanging out. Seemed breathable - my feet didn't overheat. The shoe is attractive, although I usually go for a simpler looking sneaker. I've gotten nothing but compliments on them. Overall, no issues on fit at all and is a well made, quality sneaker. 4 stars, instead of 5, only because I wouldn't wear them to do sports - the sole seems too soft.

reviews.title: Fun Fit
reviews.body: These shoes were so comfy! I laced them up just right and could easily slide my 8 months pregnant foot in and out. The instep and toe box weren’t too snug, but the perfect fit.

reviews.title: Better than expected!
reviews.body: These shoes impressed me much more than I anticipated. I can't speak about the original Deltas, but the Delta 2's are on point! I would say the sizing is spot on, so when I ordered the 9.5 they fit me like a glove. The primary thing I noticed when I first put them on was the ample arch support and a very cushioned sole. The first day I just wore them around the house, and I found them to be extremely comfortable.  At first I found the ankle area to be a little stiff, but after breaking them in a little,  that issue disappeared. A day later I wore these guys to play basketball. One of the coolest things about the shoe is the actual soles. What impressed me most was the grip. These shoes probably have the best traction of any of the shoes I've owned. I like that the soles are thick too, so it gives a little lift.

reviews.title: Delta 2 Jordan’s
reviews.body: These are super comfortable and lighter weight than i was expecting. They have great ankle support for a casual shoe. The suede trim sheds a bit onto the black part which makes them look a little dusty but it wipes off easily. I love the color combo and I’ve been wearing them a ton since they came in the mail!

reviews.title: Love the fit!
reviews.body: A cool retro design with a thickly stitched top makes this pair of shoes different in its league. Comfort and lightweight come to mind while choosing any footwear & these tick both the requisites and I can feel the comfort as soon as I step into these. The color combination is unique and gives an urban look without compromising on the required aspects. The heel has blue suede duels with hot 'Flash Crimson' heel tabs to provide stability. The forefront part is also equally comfortable and matches the design used for heels. The cool part is 'JORDAN' is spelled out on the shoes to make these stand out from the other shoes. I am enjoying wearing these all day and goes really well with most of the casual wear clothing. I like the shoes as it is and doesn't have any further recommendations for improvements.

reviews.title: Beautiful comfy looking pair of shoes
reviews.body: True to size and very comfortable to walk in. Love the design and fit and I could walk long hours without feeling any discomfort. I usually have complaints about the fit but I'm very impressed with this, with or without socks.

reviews.title: Comfortable Everyday Jordans
reviews.body: The Jordan Delta 2s are extremely comfortable and durable.

reviews.title: Jordan Delta 2 shoes live up to the Jordan name
reviews.body: The Nike Jordan Delta 2 shoes are terrific shoes.  While you can debate style and if it's the right shoe for your lifestyle, it's hard to argue that they are not well made high quality shoes that are worthy of the Jordan brand.

title: Nike Air Force 1
description: The radiance lives on in the Nike Air Force 1.This version of the b-ball icon adds pops of bright orange and reflective design accents to what you know best: crisp leather, Air cushioning and classic stitched details.

title: Nike Air Zoom Pegasus 38
description: Bring some smiles to your miles.The Pegasus 38 is a tried-and-true classic that keeps you bouncy and comfortable, bringing a little extra joy to your longer runs.Neutral tones are a gentle nod to the love of nature and being outdoors.Cartoon eyes on the Swoosh logo keep these lightweight shoes lighthearted too.

title: LeBron Witness 6
description: For this iteration of the LeBron Witness, we swapped out Zoom Air for visible Max Air cushioning—LeBron's favourite—to help dissipate impact forces and provide a responsive sensation.The lightweight, reinforced mesh upper keeps you contained all round, from the webbing that harnesses your forefoot to the external moulded pieces that lock in your heel.

title: Nike React Vision By You
description: Inspired by the mythical creatures of Mexican folk art, the Nike React Vision By You serves up a palette of textures, graphics and materials that let you express your wild side. Choose from 3 different mesh options that provide a natural feel and allow your foot to breathe. Add surreal comfort with Nike React foam and a personal message on the heel clip for a shoe that could only come from the dream world.

title: KD14
description: Kevin Durant lurks on the wing, waiting for the right time to strike before slicing his way through defences.The KD14 is designed to help versatile players feel fresh all game—thanks to multilayer mesh and responsive cushioning.Plus, the midfoot strap is a subtle nod to the KD4 and takes inspiration from the shape of the Grim Reaper's scythe.

title: Nike Air Pegasus 83 Premium
description: Just lace up and arrive looking fresh.With a splash of running history, a dash of retro style and a whole lot of comfort, the Nike Air Pegasus 83 Premium is your go-to staple.Era-echoing suedes and durable textile keep it easy to wear.Plush padding and crisp leather around the ankle keep it feeling like your favourite armchair.

title: Nike Renew Retaliation TR 3
description: The Nike Renew Retaliation TR 3 takes containment a step further with arc-shaped support on a redesigned sole. Soft, springy foam keeps you comfortable as you move through class-based workouts. The laces anchor to supports that hold your midfoot down securely during cardio, bodyweight moves and everything in between.

title: Nike Path Winter

Not a big fan of the fabric on the back of the shoe and also how the inner fabric folds over onto the outer, doesn't seem like that will stay dry. Laces too long, a boa shoe lace system woulda be sweet.

title: Nike Flex Experience Run 10
description: Simple and versatile, the Nike Flex Experience Run 10 is built for movement.Made for the casual runner, its secure design and lightweight cushioning in the heel help you put in miles.Bonus: The simple, redesigned upper pairs great with casual wear so you can enjoy comfort built for all-day wear.

reviews.body: I always have great reviews for Nike and their shoes. I wear all varieties of Nike shoes from training to running to other athletic shoes. I work on my feet for many hours per shift so I buy new Nike shoes every year at least 4-6 pairs due to leg and feet fatigue. These have been I believe the first negative review I have posted or experienced. These shoes are extremely narrow and should have sized up a whole size instead of half size.

reviews.title: Good work shoe.
reviews.body: I work a job where I have to be on my feet for 12 hours a day. The Nike Free Rn had worked just perfectly for me in the past, but they stopped making those. I tried a few others from Nike's walking/standing recommendations, but disliked most of them. This one being the exception. I'm someone who doesn't need much arch support and this shoe qualifies. It's comfortable enough (albeit a little narrow), looks good, reasonably priced and my work day has been pain-free.

reviews.title: Great Running Shoe
reviews.body: I've tried a few running shoes from Nike.  There was a trend for a while to have shoes fit like a sock and for some reason, this has made me so uncomfortable while running.  Always felt like I had to break the shoes in.  With these Nike Flex shoes, I felt like they fit perfectly.  Very comfortable shoe.  The tongue is not attached to the base of the shoe so you dont have that added compression on your foot.  Shoe runs perfect.  Does not feel tight at all.

reviews.title: Really comfy... bit sweaty though
reviews.body: Very comfortable shoes that lend themselves well to both walking and jogging. However, with them being flyknit and very ventilated i was surprised by how often my feet got sweaty and hot, even when not moving around.

reviews.title: Love these shoes!
reviews.body: It's very hard to find shoes that my husband will wear, so it was great to find these Nike Flex Experience shoes!  The soles flex as he walks for a comfortable fit.   We spend a lot of time outdoors, and they are great, light-weight shoes for walking, hiking, and light jogging.   As a bonus, they look great too!  As his wife, a hike without complaining about his feet is a huge win for me!

reviews.title: Great Shoe! Wish it was wider.
reviews.body: These are a great light-weight running shoe! The mesh material is very breathable, so it does a good job cutting down on sweat - which is a big plus for me. The sole has solid padding and really cushions your foot. My feet always hurt at the end of the day and didn’t with these. Overall, I’m a huge fan. I do have wide feet, so I wish I would have sized up or gotten a wide version. It did stretch to fit my foot but not as perfectly as I would have liked. Slick looking shoe as well. I would definitely recommend!

reviews.title: Super lightweight
reviews.body: These Nike Flex Experience sneakers are super lightweight! It’s the first thing I noticed when taking the out of the box. The soles are amazingly flexible, which I found really neat. The knit mesh uppers are breathable and comfy. I got a men’s size 9, originally with the intent for the shoes to be for my husband, but he felt they ran too small. I ended up wearing them, and I’m a women’s size 8, so they were large on me, but I still found them very comfortable, but would have preferred them in a smaller size. I will say, wide feet would probably find this uncomfortable, as my husband did. Based on how large they were on me, I’d say size up half a size would be a safe bet.

reviews.title: Comfortable and gets the job done
reviews.body: I really like these shoes. I've worn them to take the dog out in the rain, snow, sleet, running, work... I feel like I've done it all and they've served me well. I have decently wide feet and was worried these would be too narrow but they fit very well, especially in the toe box. They also dry quickly, a massive plus in my book. I wish they were a little flashier on the design but it is nice that they go with everything. Oh, and I'm pretty over the bright white chunky sole. I wish it were black so it didn't get dirty so fast.

reviews.title: Not for High Arches
reviews.body: I was excited to try the Nike Flex Experience shoes because I love the Nike brand, but every now and then I have some issues with the fit and this was one of those times. In terms of length and width, the shoes were great but they dud not work for my high arches.  There was definite discomfort around the arches in terms of placement as well as tightness across the top.  On the other hand, the feel of the insole and the rebound and movement of the outsole make it so that I'd still be willing to try a style in this family of shoes again.

reviews.title: Lightweight comfort
reviews.body: You know, I’ve always been a fan of Other brands after having a pair of bad Nikes as a teen. These have changed my mind. They’re very comfortable and provide excellent support. The fabric is very lightweight and the laces are strong and durable-feeling. If this is how Nike have been making their shoes, I’ve definitely been missing out. My horizon has been expanded!

reviews.title: Average shoe, good looks
reviews.body: These shoes were more comfortable than I anticipated. I have extremely high arches so I need more support than these typically provide but I was pleasantly surprised.

reviews.title: Great fit
reviews.body: Being a size 13, and 6’9” it can be difficult to find a shoe that I’m comfortable with. They are very lightweight & breathable, which is great, I just cannot speak for their durability yet which is my only concern (because they are so lightweight)

reviews.title: Pretty good shoe
reviews.body: It’s a pretty good shoe! The first couple times wearing them they are a little tight, but they fit to your foot after that. They are decently comfortable, and the style is nice. I wear them all day everyday for work and i havent had any issues. I would Probably make them a little wider if possible.

reviews.title: flexin’ with my nike flexes
reviews.body: i know my size from previously owning other nikes so the fit is decent. good toe room and size is spot on. design of shoe is appealing, but color combo i received is not my style. i prefer black soles for easier clean up and maintenance. also, not a fan of the stitched nike logo. imagine if somehow a stitch gets pulled or loose, then it will distort the look of the “check mark” logo.

reviews.title: Great pair of trainers
reviews.body: The Nike Flex Experience shoes fit true to size and are very breathable due to the material on the upper.  The thick soles provide great comfort and suggest they will be durable though I've only had them for a few weeks.  Wore these during a trip abroad and they kept my feet comfortable all day during long days with lots of walking and exploring.  I like the flexion of these shoes the most but would change the white base as it is difficult to keep clean.  Overall very happy with these trainers.

reviews.title: Comfortable shoes that look great
reviews.body: The NIke Flex Experience shoes are a nice and comfortable shoe with a great design. These shoes are very lightweight and flexible. It almost feels like I am walking barefoot when I wear them. The shoes also look great. I really like the design of the shoe and how the swoosh looks almost pixilated. The only thing I would change about these shoes would be to have more arch support. I have high arches and and could have used some more arch support. Overall, the Nike Flex Experience shoes are a nice fitting shoe that will look great on your feet.

reviews.title: Great shoes
reviews.body: These shoes are great. I am not a runner but I am constantly on the move so I needed a shoe that I can stand and move around in without having to spend too much time breaking them in.

reviews.title: Snug but comfortable
reviews.body: I usually have a good fit with a 10.5 so I got a size 10.5.  It is a snug fit where the laces almost don’t have enough length to tie. With that said, they are comfortable to wear and have a soft cushion. Very cool looking shoe with a nice combination of mesh and solid material to add some contrast in the same color. I like how the Nike swoosh has a “colored outside the lines” look.  I don’t like the white soul which is immediately dirty after wearing outside. I have had issues with sneakers in the recent past causing serious ankle pain anytime I run.  So far, so good with these shoes. I don’t have any of this pain after a few miles with these. I like the look and feel of these shoes, the weight and the comfort. They are a little tight and the laces are a bit short. Could use another 2-3 inches on the laces and I think I would not notice the tightness.

reviews.title: Excellent shoe and love the color!
reviews.body: These shoes are incredibly comfortable, durable feeling and aesthetically pleasing. The fit well for my narrow feet without being saggy as well. My feet generally get hot in tennis shoes and they felt comfortable and cool while I was active on my feet all day at work. Will definitely buy again.

reviews.title: Good looking casual wear shoe
reviews.body: I should have ordered a larger size for this minimalistic style. The shoe was comfortable enough to wear all day long. The shoe looks good. My preference is for a shoe with more support but I’m not sure that’s what the designers were going for here.

reviews.title: Great every day shoes
reviews.body: These shoes fit more narrowly than others but was still comfortable to wear. The design was nice, a bit basic but that makes it nice for an every day wear. I use these shoes in my home gym but seem comfortable enough to wear for longer hours.

These shoes run true to size, have the perfect bounce to them, and look very sleek! They are perfect for those who have plantars fasciitis and an extra insert isn't even needed with these! I love that the sole isn't chunky and I can use these for both comfort and the gym! Overall great shoes for multi-use, comfort, and fashionable.

reviews.title: Nike Flex
reviews.body: My husband found these shoes to be very comfortable and lightweight. The material is very nice and the colors are bold, yet still subtle enough to not be too loud. Overall, this is a great pair of lightweight, athletic shoes.

reviews.title: Looks Good, Comfortable, Weird Sole
reviews.body: Overall these shoes look great and are very comfortable. The mesh gives them a very light, comfortable feel and good airflow for cooling. The only con is the design of the sole. The sole has several slits that open up as the shoe flexes and then close when the shoe is flat. This sole design is fine on hard surfaces, but grass, dirt, or gravel can get stuck in these slits. Time will tell how they hold up, but so far they are excellent.

reviews.title: Very comfortable
reviews.body: I work on my feet all day and my feet always hurt after a long day. With these shoes, my feet dont hurt. I feel like Im walking on a cloud. They are super comfortable and very durable. I like the color and think they are so easy to clean. The blue logo makes the shoes stand out. I had so many compliments so far. I also like the breathable material so my feet air out when they start to sweat. I love these shoes and wouldnt change a thing.

title: Jordan Stay Loyal
description: Straight from our past and into the future.The Jordan Stay Loyal takes cues from the classic Air Jordan 12 to create a shoe that's fresh yet familiar.Inspired by the 12's durability, it features burly leather overlays and rubber herringbone traction that wraps up the toe, sides and heel.

title: Kyrie 7
description: Kyrie Irving is a creative force on and off the court. He needs his shoes to keep up with his playmaking, but also sync with his boundary-pushing style and ethos. Tuned for the next generation of energy return, control and speed, the Kyrie 7 helps players at all levels take advantage of their quick first step by optimising the shoe's fit, court feel and banking ability.

I got the 10.5, but somehow they were too small, so I had to return that pair and get the 11. I've been using the women's 11 for about a month and a half now, and they fit great. These shoes

reviews.title: Awesome shoes, just a bit tight!
reviews.body: I own a moving business and my favorite shoes to wear for work are basketball sneakers.  In the 2 weeks I’ve had this pair, they have been great.  It’s been a bit rainy here lately, and the grip is awesome, even when slippery.  The design/look is great – I’ve received multiple compliments from friends and customers!  The one downside is that they are a bit tight.  I have them in my normal size, but might have sized up half a size for a more comfortable fit.  I hope these will last, normally I will rip through the sides of the shoe (side near pinki toe) after a few months due to the nature of my job, but I’m hopeful these will hold up!

reviews.title: Great shoes: aesthetically and functionally
reviews.body: These are a great quality pair of shoes. They feel durable, yet lightweight. The sole is comfortable, has great traction and definitely gives you some extra bounce.  They are brightly colored with a subtle design, but not too flashy.  The only downside of this shoe, is that they seem to run narrow- I would order a half size up next time.

title: Nike Air Max 90 Surplus
description: The Nike Air Max 90 Surplus winterizes the athletics classic you love. Large rubber lugs, tough overlays and durable TPU accents combine with the composite toe cap for a weather-ready shoe. The internal stash pocket on the gusseted tongue adds a fun touch that allows you to carry just what you need. Winter or not, here you come.

title: Nike Free Metcon 4
description: The Nike Free Metcon 4 combines flexibility with stability to help you get the most out of your training programme. Updated "chain-link" mesh cools and flexes as you speed through agility drills, while support at the midfoot and heel braces you for your heaviest sets in the weight room.

reviews.title: Poor durability
reviews.body: This is the second Metcon I have purchases from Nike stores directly that have fallen apart within a few months of light use. The chain link mesh on both sides of the shoes has frayed and created a hole. Comfy shoes that are stylish while good in the gym, but the lack of durability is shocking.

My old Nikes finally gave put on me. I ordered these because I saw all the gym rats had them. Best purchase ever, I do cardio kickboxing and just started lifting and these are so comfortable. Will be purchasing more in all colors! I did go a half of size up, the fit was great!

reviews.title: Get the right shoes for the job
reviews.body: After lifting in running shoes for the past year I decided to give Metcon 4 a try. What a huge difference in stability while doing squats and deadlifts. Just changing shoes allows to to way below depth on squats. I am now a believer! They are still comfort

reviews.title: Not for the heaviest weight sets

Just not enough support for squats and deadlifts. Bad enough to be dangerous for me when lifting serious weights. But a hell of a good looking shoe – just don't take it near a squat stand without a lot of caution.

reviews.title: Perfect right out of the box
reviews.body: I am on my third pair of Metcon trainers (1 pair of Metcon3's 1 pair of Metcon4's). Just received my second pair of Metcon4's. Right out of the box, these shoes look and feel great. The size chart was spot on for me. I couldn't be happier with my selection.
I use them for the gym. They work well for pretty much any workout, even squats & deadlifts. Good support, feel nice, look clean. I haven’t ever been disappointed by a Metcon product
Best training shoe I’ve had in quite awhile.

reviews.title: Best Training Shoe
reviews.body: The metcon line isn't just for crossfit athletes anymore. It is also for normal everyday people that exercise at home. This shoe does it all. Whether it's hiit cardio training or weight training these shoes are just what you need. The inside foot sleeve is flexible for those side to side movements of a hiit routine as well as sole it lets you move multi directionally with nice support. If you're weight training you have the right amount of cushion to go a little heavier on sets. They run true to size so order your normal size. I definitely recommend these shoes and I will be ordering a second pair.

reviews.title: Look and feel great, but run small
reviews.body: These are really comfortable and looked even better in person. The fit was tighter on me than ever other Nike shoe I’ve purchased, so I’m returning them to go up half a size.

reviews.title: New upper = new shoe
reviews.body: I disliked the 3 due to the upper material, which felt stiff and heavy and made the shoe feel clunky to me.  The 4 upper goes back to that light and flexible material used in the originals, and gives the shoe a much-improved feel. Nice job, Nike.

title: Nike Zoom Fly 4
description: Train hard and find your rhythm on the road.From the moment you lace up, the webbing on the upper and lacing system wrap around your foot for a secure feel from start to finish.The added flex feels highly responsive and secure with every step.A soft, breathable upper is combined with a stretchy collar for a sock-like fit for a secure, stable sensation.You've got goals to hit, lace up and fly towards a new best.

title: Nike Court Vision Low
description: So you're in love with the classic look of '80s basketball, but you've got a thing for the fast-paced culture of today's game. Meet the new Nike Court Vision Low. Its crisp upper and stitched overlays are inspired by the hook shot of old-school basketball while its super-plush, low-cut collar adds a sleek look that's comfortable day in and day out.

reviews.title: An absolute wardrobe staple white shoe.
reviews.body: These are comfortable, slick white shoes that go with anything. The low top goes great with liner socks for the sockless look without being too bulky. Classic Nike silhouette without being as bulky as AF1's. Much more versatile. Good width & height in the toebox which is a big one for me. Takes a little bit of walking to break them in.

reviews.title: Order a size down
reviews.body: I wear 12's for Nike running shoes and 11/11.5 for all other shoes. I got an 11.5 and it was enormous, but a 10.5 fits perfectly with some room. Definitely order a size down but great shoe.

reviews.title: Top Kicks
reviews.body: Very good for sp[ort or casual

reviews.title: Good daily beater shoe.
reviews.body: If you are looking for something cheap, to use on a day to day basis, this is good, but only if they are on sale. The leather quality is okay, similar to some af1's. Compared to af1's it looks like a slimmer version.

reviews.title: Great Shoes!
reviews.body: These shoes are amazing. Feels comfortable and looks very stylish. I would definitely recommend these shoes to anybody thats in love with Nike like I am.

reviews.title: Mens court vision shoes
reviews.body: They are very comfortable and look and fit great. They are true to size.

reviews.title: Awesome color!
reviews.body: Super nice color and they are very comfortable. They do run big so I had to return my first pair and sized down a whole size.

reviews.title: Cushion lo
reviews.body: The first pair of these I own was a 7 in men and I’m a woman so with the next pair that I have purchased I got a 1/2 sized down. I love them. Fast delivery
C’est parfait
very comfortable they look narrow but they are wide inside if you have a wide foot they fit very well. what I like the most that they are sewn

reviews.title: Love my Nike
reviews.body: very happy with my experience and purchase. All I wear is Nike and Jordan’s. Thank you for not having to leave my home to shop during these crazy times.

reviews.title: Comfortable and versatile
reviews.body: I bought a pair for my 15 year old son and he absolutely loves them. They look amazing with khaki's, cargo pants, jeans..they pretty much can be worn with everything.

reviews.title: Nice shoes
reviews.body: it fits well

reviews.title: Great and AFFORDABLE!
reviews.body: Bought these for my 14yo son who is into the AF1's.  These shoes are a great replacement and AFFORDABLE.  I don't think my son has even noticed.

reviews.title: Great
reviews.body: Great shoes, comfy and look great !!!! Great with any outfit

reviews.title: When I put em on they just wanted to go.
reviews.body: They’re pretty fast and they can jump pretty high.

reviews.title: Very cheap shoe
reviews.body: I want to return them. They are too big. And I’m not impressed with the stitching.

reviews.title: My shoes
reviews.body: excellent quality and service
Shoes look amazing.
Fits great looks better in person.

reviews.title: Comfortable and fits well. N
reviews.body: Delivery was on time. I love the shoes. It was well fitted and also it was comfortable. I wore it the same day I got it.

reviews.title: great slip ons
reviews.body: low profile, light weight shoe. minimal soul cushion.

reviews.title: Pleasingly Surprise
reviews.body: I have ordered a pair of sneakers from another website and had to return it because it did not fit correctly. I am please that I did not have to do that with Nike. Your Sneakers fit just right. I am tempted to order another pair. Thank you.

reviews.title: Nice
reviews.body: Super cute and looks good with lots of outfits . Not to bulky .
I definitely recommend this sneaker. Despite, not being originally what I wanted I'm glad I got this instead. The offset of the white is a great touch to it.

reviews.title: Way Cool Classic
reviews.body: Not as comfortable as the Airs are, but they're comfortable enough, and they're cool old school sneakers just like what I wore as a kid.

reviews.title: Meh on padding
reviews.body: I like the style alot, however only really enjoyed the shoe after putting insoles in it.

reviews.title: Definitely recommend this shoe
reviews.body: Great shoe to match with whatever you are wearing. Pretty comfortable. I recommend getting a size down from what you normally get as I got a size 12 and it was huge.

reviews.title: Very happy
reviews.body: Exact as advertised. Fast shipping shoes arrived within the week

title: Nike Air Flight Lite Mid
description: Take a trip down crossover lane with the Nike Air Flight Lite Mid, the '90s hoops shoe that ruled both the b-ball court and the big screen.Originally one of the lightest hoops shoes upon release, it's got all-over perforations and velvety material for a little extra flash.The ultra-plush collar and Air cushioning keep it comfortable no matter where you go.

title: PG 5
description: Paul George has an effortlessly smooth, reliably steady game.He takes his time, but he's always well-positioned to make the extra pass, cut through the lane or nail a pull-up jumper.The PG 5 combines the agile low-top profile Paul likes with flexible Nike Air Strobel cushioning.The full-length Air unit is stitched directly to the upper, bringing the plush, bouncy cushioning right up under the foot—perfect for keeping PG feeling like he's moving on clouds.

title: Nike Air Max 95
description: Taking inspiration from the human body and '90s athletics aesthetics, the Nike Air Max 95 mixes comfort with modern communication.Text bubbles meet the swiftness of Air in the iconic design that now has Airmoji patches to customise your vibe.

title: Nike Air Max 90 G
description: The original Nike Air Max 90 was renowned for its clean lines and timeless style. The Nike Air Max 90 G stays true to the OG icon with a few updates made for golf, like integrated traction and a thin overlay that helps keep out water.

reviews.title: I really don't know yet!
reviews.body: My son asked for these golf shoes for his birthday in May and he LOVES them so I ordered them for my husband for his birthday which is in November.  I trust he's going to love them too because I ordered his last pair of Nike golf shoes based on our son's review!

reviews.title: Best Nike golf shoes I've tried
reviews.body: Played 18 at the weekend and were super comfy straight out the box. I did buy a half size up as the different insole makes them a slightly tighter fit to normal AM90s. Decent waterproofing too.

reviews.title: Good solid shoe
reviews.body: I bought these to replace an ecco shoe as they have changed their sizing.  Good fit although I do need a heel insert. Comfortable and stayed dry (wet grass) but i'm not sure I would wear if it's raining too hard. Only worn once but so far so good

reviews.title: Runs small
reviews.body: These shoes run small. Order a size up.

reviews.title: Nike golf shoe
reviews.body: Very comfortable and stylish golf shoe. Very happy with my purchase.

reviews.title: Great fit, comfortable shoe...
reviews.body: Fits exactly like a regular AirMax. No issues with grip on the course and they are very comfortable.

reviews.title: Does what it says, with style
reviews.body: Bought these as I already have a pair of black leather golf shoes and wanted something a bit lighter on the feet and breathable in hotter/dryer weather. Happy to say the half size fit perfectly to give that added comfort and the grip is more than sufficient in the dry. Surprised and happy my feet stayed dry despite the short showers during my round but would recommend d

reviews.title: They were great shoes
reviews.body: They were comfy shoes

reviews.title: Air Max 90
reviews.body: Crisp and comfortable, airmax fit to the golf course.
Always a great product, always a great service, not sure what more you’d need.

reviews.title: Air max
reviews.body: Great deliverey speed and product was perfect shoes fit awesome

reviews.title: Avoid if you like white trainers
reviews.body: Ok yeah they are comfy. But after 3 rounds they look awful. Exactly how AF1s go. The laces and inner looks rubbish and I will be returning these.

reviews.title: Golf Max
reviews.body: Love them! Great support, and comfortable.

reviews.title: Nice, comfortable and stylish!
reviews.body: These are, without a doubt, the nicest golf shoes I've ever owned. I was worried that my first time wearing them they'd be uncomfortable and need to be broken in. Not the case at all. These were more comfortable than my daily shoes! I would highly recommend these to anyone!

reviews.title: Nice & Comfort
reviews.body: They really look like original Nike Air sneakers, though. They are golf shoes.  They are nice and comfort.  Air cushion protect tiredness and lighten the burden on the heels. Awesome. Mesh material prevents filling with heat in shoes.

reviews.title: Best golf shoe
reviews.body: Best golf shoe for the summer, comfortable, stylish and enough grip even when wet!

reviews.title: Go Size Up
reviews.body: As per other helpful reviews, these run small and narrow so go a full size up. Not as bouncy & cushioned as my regular Max but hoping that will come as they get broken in.

reviews.title: Favorite golf shoes
reviews.body: I've been a loyal Air Max 90 wearer forever, but this is my first pair that's a golf shoe. They're awesome. Even though they fit a bit tighter/narrower than my regular Air Max 90s, there was no break in needed. I had no hotspots or blisters at all from wearing these shoes for their first couple rounds. The sole isn't very grippy, so they're for dry weather only. I'm happy to say that I can play a full 18 on a sunny day and my feet don't sweat in these shoes. They breathe pretty well.

reviews.title: Solid golf shoes!
reviews.body: Top notch golf shoes, comfortable right out of box, very minimal break in period, decent grip but probably would not wear them if it was wet outside. Just like the street shoes but with waterproofing.

reviews.title: Comfortable & style
reviews.body: This is my first time buying this air max 90, it’s very comfortable shoes made.

reviews.title: Order bigger
reviews.body: I like the look, make sure you order .5 size bigger though. Truly run small

reviews.title: Great Shoe
reviews.body: Very comfortable (I chose a 1/2 size smaller than I normally wear).

reviews.title: Not dependable
reviews.body: Nike sizing is never consistent from style to style. One style I wear an 11 and the next an 11.5. Makes it near impossible to order online. Very disappointed

reviews.title: Nice
reviews.body: Had to size up half a size but otherwise, super comfortable and light. Haven’t tested them out on the dewy grass or rain yet to see how the waterproofing holds up but I’m hopeful with Nike’s warranty as a backup.

reviews.title: Nike review
reviews.body: Love the way they feel. Haven’t played a round yet but they are comfortable to walk in.

reviews.title: Great shows, but size up 1/2 size
reviews.body: Great shoes, a bit stiff but should be very great as walking shoes for golf. Traction is good for spikeless, but size is tight. I am a 10, in any shoe, I am a 10.5 in these.

reviews.title: Great Shoe
reviews.body: Such an amazing looking shoe. In terms of grip, it’s not the best as the Vapors hold up better but to be honest, for what you need on even a muddy course these will do just fine.

reviews.title: Old School Golf Shoe
reviews.body: Love the colorways and  the OG Style. You can wear them on and off the course. The only thing is the grip could be better its spikeless after all. But, no big deal.

reviews.title: A Classic turned Golf
reviews.body: These shoes look awesome and are of great quality.  The Air Max 90s have always been a favorite of mine (I own 4 pairs)  Once I found out they were releasing these as a golf shoe I had to have them.  I've owned any and all brands of golf shoes including Nike, Adidas, Puma, Footjoy,  GFore, Truelinkswear.  I'm loyal to no brand of shoes.  These shoes feel very similar to the Air Max 90 sneaker version.  Grip is pretty good and have had no issues there.  I would say that these fit similar to the sneaker version but with the waterproofing on the shoe there is a little less give making the toe box a feel a bit snug compared to the street shoe.  I normally wear a size 11, I went with size 11 in these and they work great.  If you have a wider foot go up half a size.  If you have a normal to narrow foot go true to size.

reviews.title: Throwback Golf
reviews.body: Great look, love the waterproofing. Only drawback is they run small. Size up!

reviews.title: Runs very small
reviews.body: Shoe itself is great.  It's not some super griped golf shoe that I'd wear on wet days, just something cool to to wear for a casual round.  That being said, they run extremely short.  I'm a 11.5 in the Infared AMIII from this year, and even a 12 is tight on these.
Great shoe.

reviews.title: Looks great, and performs decently so far for a newbie
reviews.body: Disclaimer:

reviews.title: At least 1/2 size small
reviews.body: Just tried these beauties on... at least 1/2 size small.

title: Nike Air Force 1
description: With an iconic design, the Nike Air Force 1 Boot bridges indoor hoops style with the rugged outdoors. The large lugs on the rubber outsole add durable traction while the removable silicone ankle strap lets you personalise your style. The padded, high-cut collar adds heritage court comfort and features a tough webbing pull strap for a finishing touch.

title: Nike ZoomX Vaporfly Next% 2
description: Continue the next evolution of speed with a racing shoe made to help you chase new goals and records.It helps improve comfort and breathability with a redesigned upper.From a 10K to a marathon, this model, like the previous version, has the responsive cushioning and secure support to push you towards your personal best.

reviews.title: Fly by name - Fly by nature and design
reviews.body: comfort, style and a pure dream to wear

reviews.title: Excellent shoes... while they last
reviews.body: Excellent shoes with superb comfort for distance running. I wish that they were more durable, however. The sole of the shoe ripped apart on me during a 5 mile run when it got caught in some uneven pavement with very little force.

reviews.title: You won't believe how good this shoe feels!
reviews.body: Nike isn't messing around with their racing shoes. These are certainly the best shoes I have tried and I am excited to run my next marathon in them!

reviews.title: Amazing shoe but bought damaged
reviews.body: Look like amazing shoes but not sure how stable they will be and I bought brand new from the shop. Got them home and noticed damage on the heel. It’s a long way to take them back to London to return them so very disappointed! Buyer beware! Check the shoes all over

reviews.title: Not worth the price
reviews.body: I wouldn’t recommend these shoes. After two weeks of purchasing pieces of the bottom soles broke off  in chunks. Because I purchased them out of town, I was told they were unable to help with returning them.

reviews.title: A whole new run!
reviews.body: I am really enjoying the run with these shoes and enjoy them being sock-less. My only criticism is of the off centre lacing system. It allows the tongue of the shoe to move even further off cnetre which is a bit annoying, but not enough to be a deal breaker and ruin the whole new experience of the spring from the carbon fibre insert!

reviews.title: Excellent - Helps with my joint pain!
reviews.body: These shoes are incredible!! I purchased these to help manage my painful foot diagnosis, Hallux Limitus, caused by 15+ years of playing competitive tennis, which has destroyed my big toe joints. The carbon fiber technology in these shoes provide the protection my toe joints need allow me to still run and walk long distances. These shoes are superior to all all the Hoka’s I’ve purchased in the past. Very h

reviews.title: Amazing runner
reviews.body: Great runner , it will be by race day shoe .pricy but worth it

reviews.title: All hype.
reviews.body: Definitely all hype. First of all,it’s way Over priced. I thought the material would have a nice feel to it like previous Nike shoes I’ve owned and for $250 I was expecting maybe something even better. The shoe feels like it’s made of some cheap material, the paint was already chipping off before I even wore them. They feel even worse on your feet,these shoes hurt my feet worse than the boots I use to wea

First of all amazing customer service from the Nike Team. Cannot fault them at all ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️Secondly I love the trainers, they are light, the energy return feels like you are running on the track….and I know it’s not the most important aspect….but the

reviews.title: Perfect, good job nike
reviews.body: 10/10     These are my new favourite running shoes, comfy and make running just a little more enjoyable 👍🏻

reviews.title: renewed
reviews.body: this shoe has comfort and challenges me to get back out there and run.  It inspires the dormant runner to come alive

reviews.title: Superb
reviews.body: I don't write reviews often. But on use of these guys, I had too. They are everything you read them to be - sure, they are pricey, but... that price is reflected on the elite demographic the shoes are built for. If you are racing honestly, don't think twice. Buy a pair, and save them for the events. You will fly.

reviews.title: Best Running Shoes!
reviews.body: Great for cardio and long distance running, support and comfort all around would highly recommend the zoom technology is unmatched.
IMPRESSIONNANT, moi qui suis pro-adidas et bien je peux vous dire que je commence a me poser une question: changer de marque !!!!

reviews.title: Light, bouncy, meanwhile responsive
reviews.body: This shoe is awesome. Tried out for a speed work. Light, bouncy, while gives responsiveness when run fast. Not sure how the magic works though. I guess zoomx and carbon plate are well glued together. The durability is a question mark at this moment.

reviews.title: Nike ZoomX Vaporfly Next%
reviews.body: These Nike ZoomX Vaporfly Next% are the best running shoes I have ever had.

reviews.title: Too Comfy
reviews.body: I am a new runner and this shoe is so comfy. I even wear it just to go to the store now days =D

reviews.title: Best all around shoe
reviews.body: This shoe may not last a long time. But while you have it nothing feels even close. Extremely responsive, light as a feather and breathable like you can’t imagine. Get ready for some PRs. This shoe can go all day.

reviews.title: Légère
reviews.body: Très légère et confortable. Par contre c'est un calvaire pour enlever la semelle de propreté et y mettre ses semelles ... Sans rire, vous avez COLLÉ la semelle de propreté qui ne sert à rien !

reviews.title: A different shoe to the Vaporfly
reviews.body: Love these shoes. For me personally I find them a different shoe in the feel and wear in comparison to the original Vaporfly.  They feel stronger for the ankle, I find with the Vaporfly my ankle sometimes felt a little under supported, these have fixed that, the toe box size is great and I really like the upper. Strangely I don't find them as fast as the original Vaporfly.
Most comfortable pair of running shoes Nike has ever made.

reviews.title: Awesome shoe
reviews.body: The most comfortable shoe I have ever worn!  Durability (knew this upfront) is poor but that is expected with the type foam.  The carbon fiber plate makes all the difference in the world.

reviews.title: Shoe Review
reviews.body: Great Shoe

reviews.title: Best running shoes so far!
reviews.body: Soft and fast!  I love the new atom knit upper for the hot Summer runs.

reviews.title: Much more conformable than the next %
reviews.body: The upper is much improved and fits more like the 4% my feet are much cooler.

reviews.title: Lockdown not so much...
reviews.body: I got these today and took them out for a 5k run straight out of the box. Aqua color is great, same responsiveness as Next% 1. My only con is locked down. I experienced a lot of heel slippage even though I bought my same size as in Next% 1. It must be the new flexible upper or perhaps because the front-foot seems wider. Pretty certain this is what is causing the slippage. Some like the new upper, some don't. I personally don't. It's a shame as I was looking forward to these. I am lucky to have 2 pairs of Next% 1. Valerian Blue and the Pink Blast. Will always be a Nike fan.

reviews.title: solid shoe
reviews.body: Switched to Nike in 2018, 2 pairs of Zoom Fly SPs ( size 9)  and 4 pairs of  Pegasus Turbo 2 (size 8) later,  took this shoe in size 8.5 today , shaved off my Turbo 2 record by more than 20 seconds per mile on a 5 mile run. This shoe is also the most comfortable. Mid foot striker.

reviews.title: Best shoe on market - nothing compares
reviews.body: The best thing money can get you.

reviews.title: Pretty good run
reviews.body: you go zoom with these but I don't think they are that durable compared to my old rincons but feels way lighter

reviews.title: La référence..
reviews.body: Très légère et confortable, le top pour la course

reviews.title: Great fun
reviews.body: nike really got it right with the next%. now the new upper is perfect!

reviews.title: Believe the hype
reviews.body: True to size, comfy from the off and very lightweight. I've run in them for 2 weeks now and the difference they create is outrageous, even better than I expected. My previous shoes are the Pegasus Turbo 2 which are superb, but the Next % 2 honestly blows them out the water.

reviews.title: Jet powered pogo sticks.
reviews.body: Incredible lockdown. Took them out on the track doing mile repeats. I averaged 4 seconds per mile quicker than I usually do with my Hoka Rincons.

title: Nike Air Zoom Infinity Tour
description: Revolutionise your game. Inspired by a running shoe, the Nike Air Zoom Infinity Tour delivers unrivalled comfort and response. Thanks to a new, innovative traction pattern, you'll get the grip you need to maximise the power of your swing.

reviews.title: They keep breaking
reviews.body: It's a really good shoe, except it keeps breaking. I typically walk courses when I play and have broken 3 pairs of these shoes this season (having only played about 30 rounds). The review would have been a lot worse, but for Nike's good customer service.

reviews.title: Best Golf Shoes Every!
reviews.body: These are the most comfortable golf shoes I have ever owned.  The cushion and support these provide is even better than Ecco.  They run a little small but once you have the right size they are perfect.  They also have great traction on turf and I have never had issues with them slipping out like some other golf shoes.

reviews.title: Do not get the white pair
reviews.body: Amazing shoes however avoid the white pairs. The moment the knitted material underneath the Nike Skin gets wet, the moment your shoes goes from white to light brown/yellow. I dried them up however the shoes never returned to their original white color. Something around the knit die and its mesh with the Nike Skin causes the discoloration. I have been trying to reach out to Nike in order

reviews.title: Very narrow shoe
reviews.body: Nikes are typically a very narrow fit so I order a half size bigger. These are more narrow than normal. I would suggest a full size bigger. Also one of the shoes he’ll tour in the first two weeks I had them and I have yet to hear back from customer service regarding replacement

reviews.title: Size up half or a full size to offset narrowness
reviews.body: I have a very high arch / top of foot which puts me into xw for a lot of shoes. Footjoy I am UK 10.5 xw so went for 11 in these. Narrower last but plenty of flex so the fit is good. Would agree with others who say go up a size or half size. Really comfy.

reviews.title: Product different than the image.
reviews.body: The Nike shoosh is the lame one. I specifically bought from sport check cause they had the good model with the large swoosh. The shoe itself does seem like a fantastic shoe.
Great fit (true to size) extremely comfortable. Played 18 right out of the box without any issues.

reviews.title: Way too wide
reviews.body: I love the look of these shoes, but in size 15, they are just too wide in the mid-area (around my arch), and there's a whole bunch of rippling that happens on the top of the shoe when you tie it as a result.  Really disappointed as I returned my Tiger Woods shoes for these (had the same issue there and my foot is not very narrow!!)
Ordered size 11 wide, shoes run a tadsmall for length, and way too tight for width.  I don't recommend unless you have extremely narrow feet.

reviews.title: Not meant for wide feet
reviews.body: It is true what they say about the width being an issue. I got a half size up thinking it will fit but they are still squeezing my feet. I have to return these. They are a great looking shoe though.

reviews.title: Great Golf shoe
reviews.body: Snug at first but great after allowing them to stretch a bit, then for true to size. Very comfortable and the grip so far is great.

reviews.title: Great Golf shoe.
reviews.body: Amazing golf shoe, very comfortable. Snug at first given the material but stretched true to size after one use. The verdict is still out on this spike system having them not removable. First impressions after a few rounds of walking is best golf shoe I’ve owned this far.

reviews.title: Get the Wide Version
reviews.body: Love the look of the shoes and quality. Like all the other reviews here these run a bit narrow so i'd recommend trying for the wide version if not .5 size up at the minimum.

reviews.title: Feel good, play good
reviews.body: Hands down the best golf shoes on the market. They tend to be fairly tight the first few rounds, but after running around the course looking for my ball they broke in nicely. They feel almost as if you had a normal NIKE Pegasus running shoe on with the exception of cleats underneath. At the end of the day, let’s be honest with ourselves, we all play terrible golf, so why not have the flashiest shoes on the course. Feel good, and play better when your kicks are comfy.

reviews.title: Excellent Golf Shoe
reviews.body: I would agree these run a little narrow, but that works for me. Also, the NRG version runs even smaller.

reviews.title: Disappointed
reviews.body: I bought these shoes in Oct 2020 and played multiple rounds and practice sessions. The shoes look great but are extremely narrow, I don't have a wide foot and even my feet were killing me after 30 mins of wearing them. The heel is fine but the tightness really begins in the upper, midfoot and toe box. Unfortunately, a larger size won't help because a bigger size will be too big although it will help with the tightness.

reviews.title: Great feel, but tight.
reviews.body: I have a few pairs of these now.  Im a US 11.5 usually, and I always go 1/2 size up for Nike Golf.  If you have the option for the wide, go for it.

reviews.title: Runs small, looks great and super comfortable
reviews.body: Ordered a size up. Usually wear 11, but ended up with a 12. Once I got the size dialed in, these are super comphy right out of the box. Stability without a break in period. Think I found my new go to golf shoe.

Light and comfortable as a running shoe as billed. The tongue and heel pad is a little high. Toe  box area a little weird with the fabric “puckering” when laced. Reverse of what I am used to with narrow Nike golf shoe feel

reviews.title: Best golf shoe around
reviews.body: Great shoe I went true to size so a 9.5 and the left one is a little tight should have got a 10 but just wore 2 socks for a bit to break in and now they are find best golf shoe around

reviews.title: Great comfortable shoe, but order half a size up!
reviews.body: I've been buying Nike stuff for as long as I can remember. I'm usually a 10.5 and I've had no issues with their sizing, except this shoe. It does run a little bit small so order a half size up! I got these in 11s and they fit perfectly. Very comfortable, it feels like you're wearing a comfortable flyknit running shoe, and held up pretty well on the course!

reviews.title: Just wow !
reviews.body: These shoes are amazing, waited months to get a pair and they did not disappoint. I wear size 10 in all Nike running shoes and I did not go a half size up as ppl recommended as these are flyknit I knew they would break in so I went with my shoe experience instead of someones review. They were a bit tight for a few days but I just wore them around the house with 2 pairs of socks on and now they are perfect, a half size up would of been to sloppy IMO once they broke in. These shoes are unreal sable, I am totally locked in on every swing 🏌🏻‍♂️

reviews.title: Best Golf Shoe EVER
reviews.body: Incredibly comfortable shoe. Best one I have ever owned. Great traction along with top of the line design. What more could you ask for? 10/10 must buy.

reviews.title: Golf shoe Slippers!!
reviews.body: Wow! That was my reaction when I put these shoes on. I felt like I was floating on cush!

reviews.title: Idea and design of the shoes was great, I Just wish they were more durable, true to size And comfortable
reviews.body: The shoes look great and are lightweight but are at least a half size smaller than the comparable running shoes and stuff to where they don’t seem they will be stretching in the future. I also am already having problems with the stitching around the top of the shoe coming undone which I am not so upset about since the shoes are small and I am unable to wear while golfing anyway.

reviews.title: EXACTLY WHAT I WANTED
reviews.body: These shoes hit the mark in every category for me. Yes, some of the reviews that talk about a tight fit are probably correct, but, the flyknit allows your toes to move around plenty so they still feel amazing. I was looking for a shoe that had a more athletic (walking) appeal to it since I already have the more classic Tour premiere and this did it for me.

reviews.title: Way to tight! Do not buy. Unbearable pain after several holes of play.
reviews.body: Way too tight! Had to take them off after several holes. You need to try them on for a couple of hours because they feel good at first.

reviews.title: Love them
reviews.body: First new pair of shoes in a long time, coming from clunky old style shoes. These are super comfortable, definitely different. They feel loose but locked in at the same time. I put them on thinking there would be maybe stability issues but there are zero. I feel so stable in them yet they are extremely comfortable to walk around in. My feeling is these either fit you are they don't. No in between.
