I'm a 10.5 in practically everything, but I took the advice and went up to an 11 and they fit great. 10.5 would have been way too tight.

reviews.title: Very inconsistent sizing
reviews.body: I've ordered and tried a couple different pairs. The first size 13 had such a tight to box that it felt like someone was standing on my toes. The second size 13 had the left foot fit perfectly, but the right foot almost seemed like a wide width shoe. I also ordered a 14. They fit like you would expect a size 14 would fit on someone who typically wears a 13. Too big.

reviews.title: Perfection.
reviews.body: Have been looking for awhile for a good golf shoe. Nike always fits me well cuz of my narrow foot...these are perfect!

reviews.title: Well Worth Waiting for...
reviews.body: Wanted a more light weight and comfy golf shoe, and have been waiting for these to come in to stock. Read some reviews and it is worth noting you want to order 1/2 size larger than usual.

reviews.title: Looks great, comfortable but runs small
reviews.body: Overall a great looking athletic golf shoe but too small. Have had over 10 pairs of Nike Golf shoes and always worn a size 11. These are comfortable but its the first shoe I have had size issues. I have a narrow foot and it is still way too tight to spend the day playing in. Would go up 1/2 size. Really hope the flyknit in the forefoot breaks in.

reviews.title: Go a full size up!
reviews.body: Go a full size up if you have big feet. I wear a 13 and needed to go to a 14. They still are pretty narrow if you don't like that fit. I'm sure the fly-knit will stretch over time. These are awesome looking golf shoes.

reviews.title: Highly recommended
reviews.body: Most comfortable golf shoe I’ve ever worn.

reviews.title: Make the tongue of the shoe less floppy!
reviews.body: Would’ve been perfect if the shoe’s tongue weren’t so loose and floppy. It makes the shoe look sloppy.
Most comfortable golf shoes yet, keep em coming!

reviews.title: Unbelievable Golf Shoe
reviews.body: These shoes are unreal. So comfortable when walking and incredibly stable when swinging. I run very true to size with Nike (UK 9) and I thought they would be too big for me but they are just perfect. Only downside is that the cushion on the heel gave me a slight blister on both heels but this was with trainer socks on rather than full socks and it was also the first time I had worn them. Second time on the course, no problems at all.
These are very comfortable and lightweight.  The flyknit locks down your feet well.  They run about a half size small

reviews.title: Great shoe! Size Up!
reviews.body: Great shoe, typically run a 9.5 on almost every shoe I own... but had to up the size here to 10. Loving them thus far!

reviews.title: Don’t hesitate
reviews.body: Absolutely the most comfortable golf shoes I’ve ever worn. The double stacked zoom makes walking a breeze and they are much more stable than I anticipated. Great traction and breathability as well. Overall the best golf shoe I’ve worn since the TW 13.

reviews.title: They fit a little snug
reviews.body: These shoes are awesome except for the first time wearing them when they were very tight.  They did however stretch slightly to fit comfortably by the end of my first round in them.  They're very light and stable.  Hopefully they release more of them (currently sold out) as I would buy another pair.  The thin film over the shoe is amazing at keeping the shoes clean.

reviews.title: Best golf shoes
reviews.body: These are the best golf shoes I own (and I have 16 pair).  The support and comfort are top notch.  Great grip and feel during the swing as well.  Very easy to maintain and keep clean as well.

reviews.title: Probably one of the most comfortable golf shoes I own!!
reviews.body: I have to say they are very light weight and breathable.  You almost forget you are wearing shoes, seriously.  I am not surprised they are going as quickly as I thought.  Grab them quickly if they appear back in your size.

reviews.title: Love these. Very stylish and comfortable.
reviews.body: Love these shoes. Little snug right out of the box, but not a problem by the end of the round. Very comfortable,  and stable throughout the swing. I was hesitant about wearing the whites in damp turf due to cleaning. Found that they cleaned easily and held up. Best Nike golf shoe since the Vapor 2 IMO.

reviews.title: Very Comfortable... But Lacks Tractions & Needs Better Sole Pattern With Removable Spikes
reviews.body: The shoe is very nice looking in person... the sole is really close too my nike react running shoes. fits like a tight glove so go up a half size cause they run real small.  the flyknit wraps around your whole foot... I do like the heel support how it holds your heel in place and is very cushioned... no the bads... wish the built in spike pattern was swooped out for like the Roshe G sole... my foot has slipped and feel the built in spikes will last maybe a season depends on how much you really play. on mine on the left inside ankle. the seam runs my foot raw but other then that I love the shoes. very light and feels almost like a regular  running shoe... the toe box is small and shallow which is bad for some people... next time nike needs a different sole pattern and removable spikes because I think the built in spikes won't last long... these are very good but the Roshe G Tour are still my favorite shoe

reviews.title: Unstable
reviews.body: Great looking shoes!  However, the middle of the shoe is missing as it is a running shoe silhouette, no lateral support when you go through the swing.  The fly knit also has too much slack.  5 stars on look vs Tour Premiere but 1 star with performance.  Unfortunately, I will be returning.

reviews.title: Love them!
reviews.body: I walked 18 in them and love them. These are the best golf shoes I have ever worn.  They are incredibly comfortable and very stable. They lock my feet in and I found the new spike system to work well. I do recommend going up a half size over what you normally wear. If you are a walker you will not find a more comfortable shoe.  Too early to tell if they are durable but they cleaned up easily and appear to be solidly built. I would buy additional pairs if the inventory was available.  Am also hopeful they will offer more color options (like the blue trimmed versions shown in the promotional video and pictures).

reviews.title: Runs small
reviews.body: I went true-to-size and the toe-box too narrow and too shallow (note that I have narrow feet and have never had this problem before with Nike). Having to return them to go up a half size

reviews.title: Awesome!
reviews.body: These by far and away are the most comfortable golf shoes ever! I love my flyknit tennis shoes so could not wait to get these and I'm so glad I did.

Like a glove.  Great heel lock and quality look and feel in an otherwise extremely flawed design.  I wobble just walking in these.  The forefoot is a narrow platform.  My front foot rolls constantly.  I don’t know how this happened.  Go back to the design of the Koston 2 skate shoe design with lugs. Wife platform is needed for golf.  It’s between this and slippery janowski for worst golf shoe all time.  I would bet brooks doesn’t wear these in the majors and goes back to tour premiers.

title: Nike Air Max 2021
description: We could use a lot of superlatives to describe the Nike Air Max 2021.We could tell you that we've incorporated recycled materials to design a sneaker with at least 20% recycled content.Or that the new Air cushioning unit underfoot is our most revolutionary.Perhaps we'd call it the "the pinnacle of comfort"; waxing poetic about the cored-out foam midsole that gives you the lightest, softest feel.But maybe we just say it's modern meets technical with a splash of heritage DNA.What fun is there in giving away the surprises?

title: Nike Air Max 270 G
description: Look legendary in the Nike Air Max 270 G. The silhouette is a stitch-for-stitch reconstruction of the original big Air icon, with the addition of breathable mesh and innovative traction that performs at the highest level of play.

reviews.title: Very comfortable
reviews.body: Love them. Extremely comfortable though a little tricky to get your feet into (like other connected tongue shoes). Overall, very pleased. Even have a 2 yr waterproof warranty which I’ve never seen before.

reviews.title: Gtreat golf shoe, really comfrtable
reviews.body: Bit tight to start off with compared to the same trainers but after it has loosened up they are perfect. Took a few wears to get to that point, maybe 2 or so rounds
Great Shoes, very comfortable, I got 1/2 up👍

reviews.title: These shoes are great and if they get worn down. I would purchase them again
reviews.body: I bought these for my son as an early birthday present and he loves them. He says they are extremely comfortable and would reccomend then for others.

reviews.title: Super stylish, great dry-condition golf shoe, great water-resistance, but they run small!
reviews.body: I love the shoe for a dry round of golf, they’re also great at keeping the feet dry if the course is wet (obviously they won’t have the same traction as normal cleats in wet conditions though). While these are great, the reviews about their sizing are accurate, these things run about a full size small. I usually wear 10.5, and I had to get 11.5 for these shoes. They are comfortable now but they had a solid break-in period of abo
Beautiful shoe but way to tight fitting. I couldn't even get it on its so slim

reviews.title: Great golf shoes
reviews.body: Great shoes. Tough to get on but great to golf in.

reviews.title: Very comfortable golf shoes
reviews.body: Bought half a size bigger and it fits perfect. Breathability and grip was also very good.
The size 15 in this shoe is too narrow and no stretch in the slipper I couldn't even get half my foot in the shoe

reviews.title: So Frustrating!
reviews.body: I own a pair of 270 Air Max in size 11.5 and they were tight then broke in. These golf 270 run SMALL. Its due to the padded heal - id order at least half size up-I wish I knew this before purchasing - once you find out, its sold out already. Its unreal that Nike puts 11.5 on a shoe that is so clearly not 11.5 measurements. You think with todays technology, if a shoe was made small they would indicate that.

reviews.title: Very comfortable
reviews.body: Very comfortable
My husband loves them!

reviews.title: Waterproofing is key.
reviews.body: Shoes are narrow as everyone says, but fit snug and break in.

reviews.title: Nike Golf Men's Air Max 2 Golf Shoe
reviews.body: A little tight during the break in period, but a great looking, comfortable golf shoe.

reviews.title: Fantastic looking shoe. RUNS NARROW
reviews.body: As many reviews state these are great however they run narrow. Order half a size up if you can!!!

reviews.title: confortable and fit
reviews.body: very confortable trainers. My wife is very happy with her present

reviews.title: Ace
reviews.body: Love ordering from Nike fast delivery and kept up to date, these are brilliant really comfy and they wipe clean def buy another pair

reviews.title: Right Out Of The Box
reviews.body: I wore my New Nike Air Max 270 G's right out of the box and they were so comfortable I never thought about them throughout the entire round.

reviews.title: 270-Golf ultimate comfort!
reviews.body: Comfortable straight out of the box and look even better than the images on the website! Would recommend and will definitely be buying again.

reviews.title: Great shoes but check sizing.
reviews.body: Great shoes, they are slip on really with the tongue stitched into the sides, the laces do very little which makes sizing very important. Definitely go up half a size, recommended, very comfortable.

reviews.title: Look fantastic on the golf course, get these shoes!!
reviews.body: lets me firstly say it's taken me 3 months to get these in a size that fits...

reviews.title: Top pair
reviews.body: Really lovely looking pair of trainers, great for the summer - comfy too

reviews.title: 270 golf
reviews.body: I really like the Air 270's so when I finally found them in my size on the Nike app, I had to try them.  They didn't disappoint!  Like the the reagular 270's they run about a 1/2 size small, and I wear a 13, so had to go to a 14 and they fit great!  Very comfortable.  Just wish there were more color options for larger feet LOL

reviews.title: Great but...
reviews.body: Great gold shoes no issues with grip when playing in the rain and they are waterproof.

reviews.title: Best spikeless golf shoe
reviews.body: I was never a fan of spikeless golf shoes. I had tried several brands earlier, they either end up in my shoe rack for driving range and some others in the gym if I can use them. But these Air Max 270 GS are perfect! They're so light and comfortable and I never lost traction during my golf swing! I had both colors Black and all white version.
Nice shoe, but too narrow.  Hurts my feet.

reviews.title: Tough to get on
reviews.body: If you have any kind of disability or back issue or you can bend your knee because of knee replacement which is my issue.

reviews.title: As described
reviews.body: Fit true to size. Bought for a teen so reviews regarding narrow feet may be so for “older” golfers. Material is coated, I am assuming for water proofing - have not worn in the rain to date so cannot confirm. Overall, cheaper than at golf stores and my son is happy with them.

reviews.title: Best golf shoes I’ve ever owned
reviews.body: Amazing golf shoe. Definitely tight to get on. Fits a half size small but will loosen after your first round. I almost returned for a larger size but they fit perfectly after a few holes of golf.

reviews.title: Small and Stiff
reviews.body: The non golf 270s have a good amount of stretch and flexability in the opening to slide your foot in, these are stiff with no give. If you can manage to get your foot in, they are very narrow and tight. I am unsure what size you would have to order to make them comfortable but you almost certainly need to go larger that normal.

reviews.title: Narrow, but great!
reviews.body: I am typically a women's 10.5, but with the width, I had to size up to M9.5/W11. These are great-looking and comfortable golf shoes! I love my regular 270s and these aren't quite as comfy but they're almost as good. Great for a wet day and lots of walking. Definitely recommend these!

reviews.title: Super tight.
reviews.body: Great looking golf shoe but couldn’t get my feet in them. The opening doesn’t have any stretch to it. I even bought .5 size larger than I usually wear. Very disappointing.

reviews.title: Excellent shoe
reviews.body: Normally go true to size in my Nike shoes. Fits perfectly. a great shoe

reviews.title: Sizing is shocking
reviews.body: Sizing of these are terrible, couldn’t even get my feet in them to try them on they’re that narrow and a full size up! No idea why they have laces either which you can’t use to loosen them.

reviews.title: Great Golf Shoe
reviews.body: Amazing..... I mean just look at them :-)

reviews.title: Golf shoe
reviews.body: Good shoe but tight fitting. I’ve always been an 8 but would recommend getting 0.5 size bigger. Haven’t worn it for golf yet but so far pretty comfortable just a little on the small size.
These are the best Nike golf shoes I’ve worn yet

reviews.title: Great quality, but go for a size or 2 up!!
reviews.body: I was very lucky to read the reviews before purchasing. All the pre warnings of buying a size up really came in handy as even the size up is ever so slightly tight. If it wasn’t for this it would have been 5 stars. The quality is fantastic. Love them overall!

reviews.title: Fuego on the fairway!
reviews.body: The shoes look amazing. Glad to have (finally) amazing looking shoes on the course. They are light and have solid grip, even on wet/damp areas of the course.

reviews.title: Great looking shoes
reviews.body: Great shoe

reviews.title: Air Max 270 G
reviews.body: This by far is the best golf shoe I’ve ever had. It is super comfortable. Would definitely recommend.

reviews.title: Not for me, but still great
reviews.body: A beautiful shoe, unfortunately a little narrow for me, but they look great and feel very premium.

reviews.title: Top draw
reviews.body: I have ALOT of Nike shoes, but these are so comfy

reviews.title: Best Nike Golf Shoe Since Air Max 1
reviews.body: Based on earlier reviews I went a half size up and it fits great!  I was worried about the fit since I read similar reviews for the Air Zoom Infinity and they were right - that shoe is narrow A.F. even going half a size up. This shoe is not nearly as narrow.  I've only worn these a couple of times but so far it is very comfortable and there is plenty of support and grip to swing freely - even in damp conditions! The shoe seems really easy to keep clean too. Very excited to rock these!

reviews.title: Great Looking Trainer
reviews.body: They come up a bit narrow but they do look great and appear to be very durable. They are comfortable and the sole makes a huge difference to grip. I have not had the chance to take them on the course but I would recommend these shoes.

reviews.title: Narrowwwwww
reviews.body: Look great and well made, but holy geez are they narrow. Want to wear these? Forgot about socks and buy 1 size up...

reviews.title: Sold!
reviews.body: I have to say I was worried after reading the reviews of the 270G being narrow. After getting on the course it did take me 2 holes to realize this was the most comfortable golf shoe I’ve ever worn. I don’t have a wide foot or thick from top to bottom. But for me these are priceless. The best part is the guarantee on the shoe against water. Has a silicone like she’ll and believe me it works. Three to four rounds in heady dew I’m sold. Actually wipe off easily as well. I have to give these five stars!!! Just orders my second pair because who knows how long they’ll last.

reviews.title: Very comfortable and look good too, worth the price
reviews.body: Bought for my 13 year old golfer daughter.  She absolutely loves them and the fact they are waterproof means she can wear them to play all winter.  Her dad has them too!!

reviews.title: Solid golf shoe! Very comfortable...ordered in a .5 size larger than what I normally wear.
reviews.body: Live these golf shoes! Own 4 pairs of the original 270 shoes and loved them. I wanted the golf shoe for my collection! Comfy fit in the course and my feet stayed dry in the wet grass!

reviews.title: Great spikeless traction. Beautiful shoes.
reviews.body: This shoe really impresses beyond the great looks. As my first spikeless golf shoe I was blown away by the traction/grip on the shoes in post-rain grass.  Great foot/ankle stability...waterproof...and very good comfort. This shoe is a winner.

title: Nike ZoomX Invincible Run Flyknit
description: Go for those long runs with lightweight, responsive foam that delivers a soft feel with every step.A Flyknit upper gives your foot breathability where you need it most and a secure fit you can depend on.Designed for maximum shock absorption with a wider forefoot for stability and a more curved outsole for easier heel-to-toe transitions.As one of our most tested shoes, lace up and feel the potential when your foot hits the tarmac.

reviews.title: The Most Comfortable Shoe yet!!!
reviews.body: The most comfortable shoe on the market!! I love these and I’ll never go back to any other style again. They’re perfect for everyday as well I get a ton of compliments on them. Highly recommend this shoe worth every penny!

reviews.title: Volt Zap Bam Boom
reviews.body: Took a leap from the React Infinity Run Flyknit to the ZoomX Invincible Run Flyknit and love the performance of the shoe. My average mileage per week is about 20 and have 127 miles currently on my Invincibles. They've held up nicely so far and I am just noticing the bounce from the foam taking its toll and will retire at 150 miles. The bounce def lasted longer than the Infinity Run's ( 2 pairs) where

reviews.title: Best Running Shoe Ever But Questionable on Longevity
reviews.body: This has been the best, most comfortable running shoe I've ever owned.  I'm a bigger guy and the cushioning on the shoe is amazing and I have never had knee or shin pain like I have with other running shoes.  The only problem is after 4 months and a little over 100 miles of running part of the back heel is also peeling/flaking off.  I don't know how long running shoes should last but that is my only disappointment and concern about the shoe.

reviews.title: Boing!!!! Great Shoes!
reviews.body: Boing!!! Wow! I really love these shoes. Immediately when walking in them the heels feel like they have little trampolines inside. It’s like little angels pushing me back up with every step. It’s subtle but noticeable. I heard it described as squishy and I was expecting it to be like a marshmallow but it’s not like that at all and it’s quite firm but would say it’s very comfortable an
Most comfortable running shoes I’ve owned yet.  I’m mid-50’s and bigger than I should be but these definitely make miles easier.
These are the most comfortable shoes ever!!  So easy to wear all day!

reviews.title: Very nice shoes
reviews.body: The shoes is very comfy. Good for long running, but my only concern is, it makes funny noise whenever you walk, and also is so slippery when the surfacr is wet. But overall is very nice everyday shoe.

reviews.title: Good shoes
reviews.body: I liked it the heal us soft  and cushion but narrow from the toe specially I got a Pointe toe lol but yeah u can wear it for long hours without feeling tired

reviews.title: GOES THE DISTANCE
reviews.body: So far I've clocked nearly 400 km and they have held up extremely well. I'm a city runner so lots of jumping on and off of sidewalks, dodging obstacles, twists, and turns. Lots of cushioning and fun to run in. They definitely take some getting used to (particularly the outsole width), but once you've taken them for a few runs they feel natural on the feet. These are definitely *not* for walking around casually

reviews.title: Super Comfortable
reviews.body: My go to shoe for marathon training. Being comfortable and very cushioned I feel like I am giving my legs the best chance of staying injury free. Good for a range of paces too from Intervals @ 3:30/Km to Long Easy runs at 5:30/Km. Had an issue with the first pair but Nike customer service were good to their word and replaced.

reviews.title: Terrible
reviews.body: Very comfortable, but completely fell apart in less then 4 months. Not worth the money

reviews.title: Unrivalled.
reviews.body: I hadn't heard about these until very recently. They've flown under the radar. All I can really say is they're amazing. Size is exact and the comfort is unrivalled. Nike should make more trainers with a full ZoomX Midsole. Extremely comfortable and good energy return, they look good on foot and they seem grippy underfoot too. I'd definitely buy another pair. Worth every penny.

reviews.title: Confort, amortie et retour d’énergie incroyable
reviews.body: Je recommande ce produit pour les footings et les sorties longues. Le produit est très confortable quand on a le pied dedans, il dispose d’un très bonne amortie et le retour d’énergie est également incroyable. Le seul petit bémol réside dans le poids des chaussures qui sont supérieur à la moyenne donc cela demande un effort de plus pour lever le pied.

reviews.title: So comfortable
reviews.body: Probly the most comfortable pair I have yet. I needed something with super bounce and these are definitely it. The only down side to them is the foam cracks and breaks rather easily. So don't get them expecting something that's not going to look beat up. However they are a must have.

reviews.title: Like standing on a cloud
reviews.body: Very comfortable shoes, but the feel takes a while to get used to. Fairly noisy as they make a squishy sound when walking/running. I prefer a lighter shoe, so I am only giving three stars, but if you like running on a cloud, you will love these!

reviews.title: They broke on the first day
reviews.body: I bought these shoes to wear every day and run in but on the first day I wore them the midsole cracked in half leaving a 1 inch gash with the inside foam exsposed and they broke before I could go run in them.

reviews.title: Good cushion. Responsive. Shorter lifespan than expected
reviews.body: Love the shoes. Got them in April. However, the sole of the shoes worn out pretty quick. After 200 miles, I noticed foam on the other heel of both shoes. Also my feet got warm after running for a few miles. I felt like my feet were burning after a long run.

reviews.title: Amazing for long runs
reviews.body: Amazing for long/recovery runs. Keeps legs fresh! I was originally on the fence about these, reading that the upper runs hot but I find them totally fine. I typically use Tempo Next%s for faster runs and these fit nicely into the rotation.

reviews.title: Disappointing
reviews.body: I returned these shoes after owning them for just 45 days. The shoe's are very comfortable, but the foam started cracking on the heel of the shoe. Very disappointing because i enjoyed running in them.

reviews.title: I wanted to like these. I really tried
reviews.body: Owned a pair for two months after deciding to return them. The sole felt great for running however, the distance of my foot from the ground due to the size of the foam sole made me feel a bit uneasy. Yes, it did feel soft, but also unstable at times. After a few runs I realized that the heel 'popped' leaving a tear that exposed and compromised the inner foam. If it was that easy for it to tear, I couldn't find its worth in keeping the shoe for its price.

reviews.title: Amazing daily trainer for long runs
reviews.body: Super cushion for those extra long runs. Lots of space in the forefoot. Great daily trainer!

reviews.title: Durability is ABYSMAL
reviews.body: After only two wears, a small misstep led to a chunk of the Zoom X foam being popped out of the shoe. Easily one of the most comfortable shoes Nike makes, albeit a bit heavy, but the awful durability makes me wish I never bought the sneaker. I was excited about the prospect of a full-length Zoom X midsole, but never would have guessed the material would be so poorly made that it can't stand up to everyday wear.

reviews.title: Super Cushion
reviews.body: Great cushioning. Shoe fits great for those with a wider foot like myself. I run a decent amount and so far they make for a great pair of daily runners.

reviews.title: Short lifespan
reviews.body: In a perfect world, I would give these shoes 5 stars. As a boost convert, the foam on these shoes is amazing. I was also happy to have an elite midsole without the carbon plate. Unfortunately, after owning 2 pairs of these, I’ve seen the same wear pattern in the outer heel. One I noticed on both shoes after, the other I see on one shoe after barely 200 miles.

reviews.title: Great on feet!
reviews.body: Very comfortable and broke in within the hour. Looking forward to an all black color way.

reviews.title: Poor quality
reviews.body: Purchased these shoes less than 2 months.  Side of sole now has a large chunk missing.  Very disappointed in the quality of this shoe.

reviews.title: Great shoe nike always comes through
reviews.body: Very comfortable amazing shoe very wearable and goes along with everything

reviews.title: Poorly Built
reviews.body: Excellent cushion. Like the fit and look. Sole started separating from the upper after a week of walking around in them. Very light use. Not the quality you’d expect in $180 shoes.

reviews.title: A must get!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.body: OMG.... what a running shoe. Am I satisfied? You better believe it. The cushioning was better than I thought. And comfortable. 5 miles a day has not felt so good. Will get myself another pair. A++++++

reviews.title: It takes time
reviews.body: I am an avid runner and log lots of miles. When you first put these shoes on the comfort is phenomenal. It feels like walking on a cloud. But when you run in the shoe for the first time use caution. The shoe has a lot of cushion and it makes your heel toe strike feel a little messy. It feels like your running on top of pillows. For those people that like a firm hard strike and push off these might not be right for you. However, after giving the shoes a chance to break in I am pleasantly surprised by the comfort and cushion. It takes time to get use to it. At first I felt some pain and tension around the knee like another reviewer mentioned. After the shoe shoe broke in it was well worth it. It could be because the shoe requires you to utilize different stabilizer muscles. Not sure.

reviews.title:
The perfect prescription My Medical Shoe. 
NIKE ZOOM X INVINCIBLE RUN FK
reviews.body: I highly recommend this product for multiple reasons reason number one I need a hip replacement but I don’t want to have surgery and I have been delaying surgery for 16 years Until hip technology improves the shoe is powerful it gives the support I need in my feet and reduce chronic pain in my hip/feet reason number two I have a terrible back because of my hip reason number three I have a blood disorder there is no cure but there’s a cure for my feet it’s the NIKE ZOOM X INVINCIBLE RUN FK It reduces a lot of pain so I bought two of them

reviews.title: ZoomX Invincible Run Flyknit v React Infinity Run Flyknit
reviews.body: After my React Infinity Run Flyknit shoes, I was looking for a replacement and took a while to decide between the React Infinity Run Flyknit 2 or ZoomX Invincible Run Flyknit. As a fan of ZoomX I decided to go with the Invincibles. So if you're in a similar situation, maybe this comparison will help:

reviews.title: Sore calves a thing of the past
reviews.body: I have suffered through my running life for a fair while now suffering with sore calves after most runs, I tried a variety of shoes and gait analysis etc etc.  These running shoes have transformed my running experience and I not only have no calf pain, I am upping my mileage considerably and am amazed how little I suffer after my long runs wearing these.  I can't reccomend them highly enough.

reviews.title: Too big..too spongy
reviews.body: I had high expectations from this shoe but found it to be big. By big, I meant the frame. Otherwise the shoe is true to size. Bigger size didn’t mean it was heavy but it was definitely quite spongy for me. I wanted to use it for my daily walk but i didn’t feel great in them and felt like I was doing more work than I put in when wearing my epic React flyknit. I returned them and I have now ordered react infinity run flyknit 2.

reviews.title: Very comfortable daily running shoes
reviews.body: These are very comfortable running shoes. Very soft. Bit heavier but I dont really want too light shoes for daily runs,  for daily runs, shoes should be comfortable and should prevent injuries. I used to have light soreness on my achilles tendon pain, this shoes completely got rid of it and Im very thankful about that. One more very important thing is the front foot area is just slightly wider and that really helps for my toes from getting blisters. Blister free runs days after days.   These shoes seems to be very durable too. Im 130lbs and Im into 600 miles on my first pair(55 average weekly mileage)  and they dont show any sign of wear or tear. The lock down is excellent. Upper is very breathable.

reviews.title: Easily the best daily driver of 2021.
reviews.body: I'm already on my second pair and will definetly grab a third. Haven't done that since early in the Ultraboost era. Incredibly comfortable. Very light. Like others have stated you should probably go down a half size in most cases. Easily the best daily driver of 2021. My only knock are the colorways.

reviews.title: Amazing comfort but stability issues. Lifestyle buyers think twice (See paragraph 4)
reviews.body: I purchased these shoes primarily for lifestyle use though some small morning runs as well. My feet typically hurt after being on them on the job all day, so having an ultra-cushioned shoe to be able to use around town is a must for me and these check that off with flying colors. From the first second you put your foot in this shoe it's liking dropping into a padded trampoline for your feet and is unlike anything you've really tried before. For reference, I've had these for two weeks, done some short runs, and general everyday use.

reviews.title: Quality
reviews.body: At first I thought these were over priced hype but after a couple of runs the hype is real. So comfortable and the return you get from the sole is unreal

reviews.title: Ultra comfy but fails shortly after only few walks
reviews.body: I'm not a runner so this review is from a casual precpective and light runs, I've tried several Nike models over the last few years mostly are Airmax and react models like cruzrone, pegasus 37 and I was satisfied from the softness and squishy feeling until I tried the Invincible run, these are a new level of comfort, simply the softest and bounciest shoe I've ever tried in my whole life as a 41years old man, however I was planning to purchase other colorways soon until I noticed the outsole peeling off the zoomx foam though I use it only for walking and casual use and even not every day.

reviews.title: Best shoe yet….
reviews.body: This is possibly Nike’s best running shoe. It’s better than any other running shoe I’ve used. The comfort and cushion is insane! The fit of the shoe is as if it’s intentionally molded for your foot shape. I ended up ordering 3 more pairs and will most like purchase more. I typically wear a 12.5 in most shoes, and these were tts also.

reviews.title: Excellent energy return in a surprisingly stable Zoom X shoe!!
reviews.body: Brilliant weight for a training shoe of this level of cushioning. It was surprisingly stable with a nice rocker that pushes you up onto your toes, the upper is probably the nicest I’ve had in a mileage trainer.

reviews.title: I'm impressed
reviews.body: A very good shoe for steady runs of all distances.

reviews.title: A bit noisy
reviews.body: These shoes take a bit of getting used to. They almost make a suction like noise when you walk/run on them. They are a bit loud. Otherwise I like these shoes.

reviews.title: Bad feet good sneaker
reviews.body: I don’t run but I deal with a lot of foot pain. These sneakers make it possible for me to stay standing or walking for longer periods of time since they have such great cushioning. I have tried react and other zoom sneakers but these are my most comfortable. I hope to see more color ways or more sneakers with just as much comfort. The only negative is that they make a bit of noise when walking outside due to the soles but small price for great comfort.

reviews.title: A true God send for me!!!
reviews.body: This sneaker is perfect, dream like... I ran for 30 years and wore out my knee, bone on bone, and had surgery and surgeon informed my running days are over and it will a matter time for you come to me for knee replacement.... I started swimming for cardio and while it's great cardio ITS NOT OUTSIDE WHERE I CAN BREATHE FRESH AIR!!, same is true of getting on elliptic machines...All good but missed being outside in the fresh air.. I began a year ago "walking" somewhat briskly with various, recent running sneakers but found that after 2 good days of 3 mile walks my bad knee acted up almost crippling... Man was I bummed, here I thought I had found a great substitute for my love of being outside running and breathing fresh air..  HOWEVER,  LAST MONTH I CAME ACROSS/ DISCOVERED THE "INVINCIBLE ZOOMX" and bought a pair AND THESE SNEAKERS HAVE GIVEN ME MY LIFE BACK (somewhat, lol) AND HAVE BEEN HAULING ASS "SPEED WALKING" AND NOT A BLIP OF AGGRAVATION (knock on wood🙏🙏)  OF MY BAD KNEE!!.. These Invincible zoomx has been a true God send for me. On another note,  I weigh over 200 and have approximately 50 miles on them and don't see any wear on soles!!, the best wearingNike shoes I've had.. Thanks to the R&D Boys in Nike Research... Thanks from the bottom of heart...

reviews.title: Smooooth Ride!!
reviews.body: The delivery was quick! The shoes felt broke in out of the box. These shoes have an extremely smooth ride and I can run for hours without my knees and ankles taking a beating. I was referred these shoes by a friend and am glad I took his advice. Price is a little high for a running shoe so I’m hoping they last me at least 500 miles. We’ll see how they pan out.

reviews.title: Usure semelle trop rapide
reviews.body: Une superbe chaussure pour éviter blessures , amorti au top , mais l’usure de la semelle est trop rapide , je suis à environ 400 kilomètres et on voit déjà la mousse au niveau du talon …sur les deux chaussures … et je suis un coureur poids léger  1’80 pour 65 kg

reviews.title: Just the shoes I've been looking for.
reviews.body: After a handful of runs in these shoes, I can honestly say they are some of the best shoes I ever bought. The foam is incredibly responsive, so any runs with a steady pace are ideal for these shoes. They are not built for speed, as the foam is too bouncy, but other than that, they are designed for extreme comfort and style, and I couldn't recommend them enough.

reviews.title: Best comfortable shoe
reviews.body: Great feeling show when wearing them and easily the most comfortable shoe I have. With that said I'm not a big fan of running in these. They seem a little unstable when I run which could because of the bounce they give. I rather stick to my Pegasus for running and wear these just for walks or casual wear.

reviews.title: Incredible comfort and feel
reviews.body: The best running shoes I’ve ever tried, absolutely love them

title: Nike Waffle Trainer 2
description: Staying true to the timeless athletics style you love, the Nike Waffle Trainer 2 brings you the classic look of heritage Nike running.With its iconic Waffle sole, large retro Swoosh and era-reflecting suede accents, it's refreshingly retro.The plush foam midsole with extra-soft foam wedge is so comfy it should be banned, while the exposed foam tongue adds the perfect flash.

reviews.title: Black Waffle Trainer Review
reviews.body: Good quality trainer at a good price

title: Jordan ADG 3
description: Taking its cues from the Jordan 4, the Jordan ADG 3 is the perfect pairing of iconic style and golf performance. With responsive Zoom Air and infamous wing-shaped upper eyelets, they'll cushion and support your feet from the course to the concrete and everywhere in between.

reviews.title: Stylish & Comfortable with Great Performance!
reviews.body: The Jordan ADG3 golf shoe is a fantastic shoe! I bought a pair of the “white cement” ADG3 golf shoes and loved them enough to buy another pair in this color scheme! Super comfortable, great grip for a spikeless golf shoe and a great looking shoe! Only issue I have is the bottom of the sole squeaks a little bit after wearing them a few t

reviews.title: Great quality golf shoes
reviews.body: Love how the shoes feels very low to the ground, great grip, and wraps around my foot with great comfort.  I utilize my body to unload the power when I hit golf balls, and need a good stability.  this shoes makes me confident doing so.

reviews.title: Squeaky shoes
reviews.body: Nice fitting shoe. But they squeak and its loud and annoying wish there was something that could be done about this. These are not cheap shoes i expected better quality to which let me down.

reviews.title: Squeaky
reviews.body: Lord knows I love Jordan's too much, but they really need to solve this SQUEAKING problem
As soon as they get a little wet they start squeaking

reviews.title: Top quality shoe as always from Jordan Brand
reviews.body: Excellent product and fast delivery.

reviews.title: Very happy
reviews.body: Lightest and most comfortable golf shoes I’ve worn. The style suits perfectly.

reviews.title: Squeaky Jordan’s
reviews.body: They’re comfortable but they squeak when you walk. I’ve only worn them once, hopefully it goes away

reviews.title: Nike Michael Jordan Golf Shoes
reviews.body: Have worn these shoes twice now and the squeak is unbelievably annoying. These shoes are super comfortable but will likely sit in the closet for the remainder of my ownership.

reviews.title: Squeaky shoes!
reviews.body: Squeaks when I walk. Very distracting when I golf.

reviews.title: Air Jordan golf shoe
reviews.body: Very comfortable, great grip, recommend highly, and stylish as well

reviews.title: Comfortable on the course
reviews.body: Great shoe for Golf. Super comfortable and very easy to work in

reviews.title: Comfy but annoying
reviews.body: Sportchek themselves did a great job getting the shoes to me … although the shoes are very comfortable they squeak … which is very annoying around the greens

reviews.title: Great for Walking
reviews.body: Very comfortable as I wear them to walk the course after rainy days. Good grip despite being spikeless..and they look good!

reviews.title: Most comfortable shoes
reviews.body: Feel great. Like walking on air. Had zero break in time. Have even golfed in the rain and left with dry feet
The shoes are great.  The fit is great. The look is great.But….. they sure do squeak a lot a lot when you are walking. I’m scared if I wear them in my golf league I will be kicked out.

reviews.title: Great product and value
reviews.body: Great product, very well manufactured, I expect them to last long. Average comfort. Nice sole gripping.

reviews.title: Tread gone
reviews.body: The tread started to wear quickly. After 1 year tread is gone completely.   walked about 3600 km or 2200 miles

reviews.title: Cool golf shoes!
reviews.body: Overall these are nice looking golf shoes. Love the Jordan logo, love the classic cement style. They are lightweight and look awesome! These are my first non spike golf shoes and I prefer spikes. I find my self slipping from time to time in these. They also run .5 big. I’m true to size 12 when it comes to Jordan or Nike shoes. I had to exchange the size 12 for 11.5. Overall a 4 out of 5. But for the price point not sure if they are worth it.

reviews.title: Loud And Annoying
reviews.body: So loud and annoying. I caught myself trying to tip toe off the greens. I’ve had them a week and I doubt I’ll wear them again. Comfortable and good looking but golf already is between the ears and this is overbearing loud.

reviews.title: Squeaky
reviews.body: The shoes are good looking & very comfortable.  But (as others have pointed out) they squeak. My squeak started during my 2nd round. Its a little annoying but I joked that Jordan wanted them to squeak for a basketball court effect.

reviews.title: Great looking but squeaking is so loud
reviews.body: I have walked about 4 rounds in these shoes. The left shoe started to squeak under the ball of my foot right away. Yesterday, both shoes were squeaking so loud that I had to change shoes after 9 holes because it was so distracting. One golfer joked he was going to call me Squeaky from now on. It is too bad because they look so good and are comfortable. Not sure I will ever wear them again because of the squeaking. I keep them in my locker so they are not wet. I have 4 pair of Nike golf shoes and this is the only pair I have been disappointed with.
the best shoes for my feet
I’ve been looking for these for a while. I bought two pair but the North Carolina blue is what I was looking for. On point for Golf and also casualwear.

reviews.title: Sick
reviews.body: These J’s are sick, I’ve got 2 pairs black and white and wife’s got a pair. We’ve both played 10-15 rounds in them no squeaking. Fit wide, super comfortable and nothing better than showing up in J’s to the golf course.
Good look and comfort.

Unbelievably comfortable, until just like another reviewer stated, around hole 8 the first time you use them…squeaking. Mine were magical enough that both shoes started doing it almost the same time. Wouldn’t want a strange rythym when you walk.

reviews.title: The squeaking is insanely annoying
reviews.body: The shoes look and feel great and are nearly perfect, until you begin walking. I made it about 8 holes before the squeaking started. It's unbearable. I didn't buy last year's Jordans because of this issue and had hoped it had been resolved. It hasn't. Unfortunately, I cannot recommend these shoes under any circumstances and am currently seeking a refund for them.

reviews.title: Squeaking
reviews.body: These shoes are very comfortable, but the squeaking is almost unbearable.

reviews.title: Great shoe BUT
reviews.body: Shoes look better in person than they do online.  Super comfortable and fit true.

reviews.title: Best Jordan Golf shoes for comfort
reviews.body: Probably the most comfortable Jordan golf shoes I've worn to date..  four putted twice so I could just walk back and forth they were so comfortable.

reviews.title: Only durable for 3 rounds
reviews.body: I bought these as a gift for my Fiance and they have started falling apart after only three rounds.  They were comfortable and good-looking, but the sole started peeling off the body of the shoe.  Completely disappointed that these didn't last more than one week of golf.

reviews.title: Great golf shoes
reviews.body: They’re great for golfing except on the 3rd and 13th holes.

title: Nike React Infinity Run Flyknit 2
description: The Nike React Infinity Run Flyknit 2 continues to help keep you running. A refreshed Flyknit upper uses Flywire technology for support and breathability where you need it. Higher foam provides soft responsiveness and long-lasting comfort, plus a wider forefoot helps lessen the chance of stress-related injuries. It's still one of our most tested shoes, designed to help you feel the potential when your foot hits the pavement.

reviews.title: Tongue not sewn on tightly
reviews.body: Just as many on here have indicated, the tongue on these shoes ripped nearly right away. I tried to live with it for awhile, but they are ridiculously unwearable as the tongue now flaps around. What a waste of money.

reviews.title: i have only Worn Nike walking and daily shoes for over 30 years now
reviews.body: This is first pair of Nike with high arch I didn’t see in description they were made this way hopefully they level out or I might have to return other wise love shoes

reviews.title: Great looking shoe. With good support.
reviews.body: Take some time to break in. But overall great looking shoe

reviews.title: Not as durable as prior
reviews.body: Comfortable, but not durable. Separation starting from midsole and upper

Very disappointed...on my third run within 2 weeks of receiving trainers the tongue ripped. Only done less than 15 miles. Can't fault them as running shoes as very comfortable and no issues with service from Nike but the quality should be much better than this for the cost. Sadly I'm returning them and my size no longer available so will have to look for something else

reviews.title: Great shoe but tongue ripped
reviews.body: Very comfortable and love the way they look but the second week I wore them the tongue ripped as I pulled it up to tighten the laces.  I've never had this issue with any Nikes before and I'm very disappointed.

reviews.title: New Version, same great shoe
reviews.body: This new model fixes some of the issues that the original React Infinity had, especially around the ankle comfort. Same great fit and comfort.

reviews.title: Too much arch support
reviews.body: Didn't try to run in these shoes after I felt the very high arch support. My UK 9.5 weighed in at 310g each. In the minute or so that I had them on my feet, I didn't like their resistance to move forwards, maybe they'd feel different while running.

reviews.title: Great set of shoes
reviews.body: Really good set of running gym shoes got loads of cushion in the sole

reviews.title: Excellente paire
reviews.body: Un bon maintien et de bonnes sensations pour cette paire qui m’accompagne lors de mes runs quotidiens
I just purchased this shoe in the all white color-way on Saturday and I love them, these are by far the most comfortable Nike shoe I’ve worn in a very long time

reviews.title: Great shoe, weak tongue.
reviews.body: I gave this a 4 star rating because my feet haven't felt this good in years.  I wear these while walking my dogs 3-4 miles a day, they feel great and my legs feel more lively.  However, the first time I put these on I pulled on the tongue of the right shoe with little force and the tongue ripped, so I was careful with the left.  The shoes are still wearable, but this was disappointing. The rest of the shoe seems durable and I haven't run into anything else, but only time will tell.

reviews.title: One of the best easy-day/recovery run shoes I have used. Good for Plantar Fasciitis and Peroneal Tendonitis.
reviews.body: As a supinator, the outer edge of my running shoes, near the ball of the foot, receives the most wear. After only 100 miles, many shoes will have a noticeable gouge taken out of the outsole at this spot. The Infinity Run 2 has a uniquely durable yet thin outsole rubber that lasts me at least 300 miles before starting to wear through to the underlying midsole. This outsole durability, combined with a soft yet springy midsole material, has made it my go-to easy and recovery day trainer.

reviews.title: comfy
reviews.body: they are nice high off the ground has a lot of give to them the only thing that is weak on them is the Tonge started to rip

reviews.title: Highly recommend
reviews.body: Fell in love with this look. It’s hard to find all white(clean looking shoes) any more. I’m my opinion Nike needs to come out with more.

reviews.title: 100% Worth it.
reviews.body: These shoes are very comfortable while maintaining perfect stability.  And they are beautiful.  I’m not accustomed to getting complimented on my running shoes!  ❤️

reviews.title: A better shoe the second time around
reviews.body: I owned two pair of the React Infinity Run and found them super comfortable. I very much appreciate the improved ventilation across the toe box in this model, makes a difference on a 5 mile walk on at 75 degree day.

reviews.title: Solid Performer
reviews.body: Running in the summer your feet can get really hot; these shoes are about as good as you can hope for for breathability. Only had them a couple of weeks but a great improvement of the last Nikes I tried (joyrides). And have not had the problems some mentioned about threads tearing

reviews.title: Fantastic shoes
reviews.body: These shoes are absolutely amazing. I use them as a daily shoe, not a running shoe. The comfort level is elite. Compared to my made in USA new balance 990v5, they are pretty close to that comfort level. The design is fresh and sleek. And the breath ability is really good. I would highly recommend these shoes for anyone needing an all day comfort shoe.

reviews.title: A rare miss
reviews.body: In the last 40 if not 0 pairs of Nike running shoes I have purchased this is the first bad product I have came across. The shoes have a plastic piece that runs above the mid-sole around the majority of the footwear that digs into the flynit and right into the arch of my foot. I am a little surprised that this wasn’t noticed in testing but nonetheless a great looking shoe and has everything else I would expect from a good running sneaker.

reviews.title: Comfort at its best
reviews.body: I have several of this style, and they are all very comfortable. I don't wear them for running, just general wear. This latest iteration does away with the sock style fitment and instead has a tongue. Some slight design changes in the toe box as well. All this adds up to the most comfortable Infinity React yet

reviews.title: Fit, trop fit
reviews.body: Chaussures très serrées, à éviter pour les pieds larges. Elles ont également Accentué la pronation. Notation dure, mais chaussures pas faites pour tout le monde

reviews.title: New Standard in Training
reviews.body: Perfect combination of stability and cushion.   They feel great regardless of the challenge.  Sizing is spot on for me.  These are my new go to for training, I have theee different pair to get me there!   Winner!

reviews.title: comfortable running shoes but weak tongue threads
reviews.body: i got these in Black/Black/Iron Grey/Black a couple of days ago along with the 2090 max air's that i got in  Black/Wolf Grey/Anthracite/White. first thoughts were that i liked the look of these much more but after trying both pairs on, the 2090's felt much more comfortable. they felt better sized for my feet so I was surprised to find that i preferred the React pair more for running. I ran with those the first day which felt great but was looking forward to comparing with the 2090's which felt a bit heavier and different in how my feet hit the pavement. There's a bit more bounce and propulsion with the React pair and looking forward to running in them again tomorrow.

reviews.title: Finally: a proper running shoe for me...
reviews.body: I have recently been Gait tested and had been recommended these and some competing brands over the React Milers. I am wide footed and these shoes account for that as well as providing the usual support and cushioning I would expect.

reviews.title: Great trainers
reviews.body: Really love these trainers. Used them for a run straight out of the box. Comfortable and supportive. Feel a little faster than other runners I have too. Fit me perfect as per normal Nike sizing.

reviews.title: Good shoe/Horrible tongue design
reviews.body: Tongue is held together by stitching that is durable as a piece of hair.  Great looking shoe and feels comfortable but you have to barely touch the shoe when putting it on because the tongue will rip.

reviews.title: Great shoe
reviews.body: Ordered this for a daily wear. He wears a shoe for the sake of having proper support and these shoes are very comfortable and supporting!

reviews.title: Sick Comfy
reviews.body: Amazing comfort.

reviews.title: Fits perfectly for overpronaters
reviews.body: It worked perfectly for my flat footed spouse. Do order half size up so that the toe box is comfortable

reviews.title: Very Comfortable
reviews.body: Comfortable with a very plush midsole all while maintaining good support. I'm flat-footed and this shoe is comfortable for me.

reviews.title: Tongue rips
reviews.body: Great show but third run and like the other reviews the tongue tore right off. Disappointing with the $$ of the show

reviews.title: Too snug
reviews.body: Looked good but tongue tore loose underneath the overlap while pulling on tongue to get them on.
Very comfortable, a little tight overall. I would recommend getting a half size up.

reviews.title: Nike React Infinity Run Flynit 2
reviews.body: This is an outstanding shoe that performs exactly as advertised.

reviews.title: Ripped Tongue
reviews.body: I work on my feet over 50 hours a week at a hotel and walk over 80 miles a week for work. So I need a top of the line shoe for my job. I thought I had found my holy Grail. Unfortunately the shoe tongue ripped after a few uses. A shoe of this caliber should not rip.  Such a bummer because I really loved this shoe and was thinking of buying more colors. Too bad..

reviews.title: Super comfortable running or walking shoes
reviews.body: These shoes are AWESOME.  Super comfortable!  I wish they were cheaper so I could buy more.  I love them.  One of the best shoes done by NIKE!
Great shoes. Very comfortable and l like the color. They seem durable since they have the round heel instead of the pointy. Would like a lightweight version though but overall still great shoes.

reviews.title: Runs a tad narrow
reviews.body: Runs a tad narrow and the tongue stuff you read in other reviews is real. First pull, tore it. Pretty unacceptable for a shoe of this caliber to have that happen.
DO NOT PULL ON THE TONGUE! RIP

reviews.title: Awesome kicks
reviews.body: Love these shoes. Super comfortable and great cushioning on the whole foot. They run a tiny bit snug on the forefoot.

reviews.title: Best shoe yet!
reviews.body: I'm a diehard Ultra Boost customer.  Having said that, I have a pair of Nike's (can't remember model) that always felt just right.  This shoe has been discontinued so I gave the Flyknit 2 a try.

reviews.title: Comfort right out of the box 👍🏼…..Nike Thx again Kirk Mc
reviews.body: Right out of the box Nike React Infinity Run Flyknit 2 are amazing…..Comfort, arch support, light weightand stability while walking or running. Liked Nike React Infinity Run Flyknit 2 so much after wearing them for a week I bought another pair.

reviews.title: Nike React Infinity Run Flyknit 2
reviews.body: Best support shoe I’ve had, 2nd pair, first shoe n 15 years I didn’t have to put my own insoles in, Hope they don’t change it. (Used to wear Nike Air Zoom Structure)

reviews.title: Best running shoe I’ve ever bought
reviews.body: Absolutely comfortable, a pleasure to run on

reviews.title: Great shoes, run a half size small…
reviews.body: Great running shoes. Ordered a half size up from size in Pegasus and most other nikes I’ve worn. But these might be the best running shoes I’ve owned and I’ve tried many different brands and styles. Putting about 100 miles per month on them and they hold up well.

reviews.title: React Infinity 2
reviews.body: Tongue ripped apart. Be careful not very durable.. I havent tried that hard but its tongue is so slim the shoe less ripped it apart. Otherwise good shoes..
Pulled on the tongue to get my foot in and tore the stitching. Not to bumped about it since I am going to beat these to the ground. Still pretty comfortable for my first wear.

reviews.title: I love these
reviews.body: These are comfy, good for running, and look so cool. Buy them. You won't regret it.

reviews.title: Plush!
reviews.body: These are great looking and so comfortable- for running obviously but also for leisure. Look decent in the white for summer. Best arch support of anything I have tried yet. Pretty rugged to with the large slab of React

title: NikeCourt Vapor Lite
description: Like a racing car, the NikeCourt Vapor Lite keeps most of its features under the bonnet.Its unique cushioning system is built to help you get to the ball as fast as you can.An innovative, 4-point strap takes inspiration from racing-car harnesses to help keep your foot locked down during your fiercest matches.All in a lightweight, breathable design that's incredibly comfortable.

reviews.title: Quality on top of good looks
reviews.body: As usual nike never disappoints

reviews.title: Super comfy show
reviews.body: Super comfy shoe! Not sure about durability yet, but it's comfort outrank anything else

reviews.title: not good for high arch and narrow feet
reviews.body: They actually feel very comfortable and light, but my right foot hurts (I'm left-handed) after wearing them.

reviews.title: Trying to get used to them. My left foot hurts
reviews.body: Are heavy when I am playing tennis 🎾

title: Nike Legend Essential 2
description: The Nike Legend Essential 2 comes equipped with a flat, stable heel, flexibility under the toes and side-to-side support. With tons of grip, you're ready to lift, HIIT, conquer a class or get stronger on the machines.

reviews.title: Awesome

reviews.title: Great gift! He loves them. ❤️‍🔥

reviews.title: Good sizing, comfortable right from the get go.

reviews.body: Nice shoes. Comfortable and seem like they will be durable.

reviews.body: Great cushioning and very light. My kid loves these shoes

reviews.title: Can’t go wrong
reviews.body: Very light and comfortable, one of my favorites

Pas la bonne taille prendre au dessus

reviews.body: Runs about 1/2 size small

reviews.title: Good shoe
reviews.body: Really nice. Comfortable and look sharp. Breathe well

reviews.title: Comfy and versatile
reviews.body: Super comfy! Can be used for both smart and casual outfits. Great for the price

reviews.title: Love the look
reviews.body: Love the way they look and they are comfortable

reviews.title: Size up!
reviews.body: Good lateral support, but I wear a size 13 in every Nike shoe and this shoe is borderline too small.  Since there is no size 13.5 and I fear 14s would be too big, they work for the classes I use them for.

reviews.title: Excellent quality
reviews.body: I am very happy with my tennis shoes. I will soon make another purchase. Thank you very much NIKE.Com

reviews.title: Great Run.
reviews.body: Not only do I run with it but also use it for every day life! very comfortable and sleek looking this shoe is awsome highly recomend you give it a try!

reviews.title: Avengers
reviews.body: Good shoes. Excellent fit. Comfortable. I use it work.

reviews.title: LIghtweight trainer
reviews.body: Lightweight but feels very supportive. Fit's narrow. I have wider feet and though it still fits, fees a bit snug - seems to have "stretched" out a bit since first putting on.
This sneakers are amazing! Took them for a run and it was like running on a cloud. Also in the workroom are amazing for lifting. Great purchase.

reviews.title: Worth it
reviews.body: All around comfy and good shoe, price was perfect as well.

reviews.title: No Days Off
reviews.body: These shoes are real comfortable and light. I have wide feet. My actual foot size is 13. I ordered size 14 and they fit great! I plan on purchasing another pair very soon because I already know this is my forever training shoes.

reviews.title: Love these!
reviews.body: Ordered these shoes online for my husband for Fathers day.. not only was the checkout n pickup so easy.. but these shoes are awesome!! Super lightweight, breathable. My husband loves his new shoes!
Magnifique 😍

reviews.title: Product & Customer service
reviews.body: They look great! Super comfortable and so far they’re holding up very well! Very happy with the purchase. As well as the customer service

reviews.title: Comfy shoes, but crazy narrow.
reviews.body: Really skinny at the toe. Not ideal for wide feet.

reviews.title: Poor quality of shoe
reviews.body: The shoe is very poor quality, i can see the patching and gum
Great shoes to walk,run, and even for the gym. Very comfortable and also a great look to it

reviews.title: Nice Style
reviews.body: fits perfect, looks good and a great price

reviews.title: So far so good.
reviews.body: Looks fresh, runs small. I sized up by a half size. Took one wear to make them fit right but they are very comfortable and provides good stablilty for cadio involving high impact movement like repeatitive jumping. I haven't owned these long enough to know how they hold up after regular long time use. I hope they won't let me down because my experiance with Nike kicks is they're awesome for the first couple months but don't last long after regular use. We shall see.

reviews.title: Great Gym Shoes
reviews.body: Brilliant shoes for the gym, sturdy and comfortable on the floor or the treadmill

reviews.title: So comfy!

reviews.title: My fav shoe!
reviews.body: I bought this shoe just because I liked the look and price.  I get tons of compliments on the shoe, but that doesn't speak to how comfortable it is.  When looking at the sole, you would think it's like walking on a cloud, but its not.  The sole is actually very pretty solid ad durable.  The real comfort lies inside. I have used orthotics for quite some time because of a hip injury.  I have yet to even feel the need to put them in this shoe.  As a matter of fact, my hip actually feels better when I wear these. Wish I could buy them in every colorway because of that alone. I know everyone is made different, but for me, these are everything. They have change my life in terms of comfort.

reviews.title: New best friend

reviews.title: Space hippie and crater impacts
reviews.body: I want some more colorways in the crater impacts and space hippies love the shoes. Most comfortable shoe I have for sure

reviews.title: Stylish and comfortable
reviews.body: I’d like to start by saying I’ve been a die hard Nike fan for my whole life. I always love the styling of their products and the comfort is always spot on. These sneakers did not disappoint. They are super trendy without being over the top. The colors are great and they pair so well with all of my Nike sweatsuits. They are ridiculously comfortable and fit like they were made for my feet. I’ve been wearing these shoes for about 2-3 weeks now and they are my new go to sneaker. I can wear them all day with no discomfort, no back pain (that says a lot for being a 45 year old mad), and no sweaty feet. I love the way these shows look and feel and I wouldn’t change a thing about them. Love them and will be buying matching pairs for my sons as well!

reviews.title: Environmental Comfort
reviews.body: These sneaker are super comfortable. Felt my feet were well supported with a nice amount of cushioning. The design is pretty different than anything I've worn before, but it really grew on me. I loved that the sole had all of these flecks of color in it. It is great to have a product made with recycled content. Since I usually go thru one to two pairs of sneakers a year, it's nice to recycle than send products to a landfill.

reviews.title: Great!
reviews.body: Great!

reviews.title: Love love love

reviews.title: Great looking shoe!
reviews.body: There is a lot to love about this shoe! I love that the sole is made with recycled materials that give it a futuristic look while also taking a step (ha - see what I did there?) towards eco-consciousness. The all-white color makes it a versatile casual shoe. The foot bed is a bit on the firm side for my liking. I have flat feet and they really complained about the arch support but I got used to it over time and can wear them all day with no issues. I wear them now nearly every day!

reviews.title: Nike shoes
reviews.body: I love these shoes but they are a little tight around the middle laces, maybe once I break them in more they will loosen up a little bit. They have a super cool design and a cool orange color. They are very durable and I love that they are made using recycled materials. I wear them daily and they are comfortable but I also didn’t want to wear them all day in Las Vegas as I feel with all the walking they wouldn’t be too comfortable. I loved everything about this shoe but the ankle is really low and I didn't feel like I had too much support. Overall they fit great, they are just a little tight.
Very comfortable sneaker, like the mission behind the sneaker. Definitely recommend this sneaker for people who is constantly on their feet.

reviews.title: So Comfortable
reviews.body: These Nike sneakers are the most comfortable sneakers I have ever worn. I wore them on a run and no issue. The sneaker itself is very stylish. I love the color combination. My sister saw them and love them so much she is buying a pair. Nike has always made great products but now that they are moving to sustainable materials and still able to knock these sneakers out of the park is amazing. Keep up the amazing job!

reviews.title: Sustainable cool mom shoes
reviews.body: Got these in the mail 2 weeks ago and have been wearing them nonstop since. Fit true to size. Not tight in the toe box which is super important to me since I have wide and flat feet. Love the design! It’s hard to make white shoes not boring but I love the neon accents. They’re just enough so my shoes match pretty much all my athletic and leisure wear. I am able to wear it to work all day (I work in healthcare) and then go pick up the kids after school and still go on walks with them after. Love how versatile, stylish, and comfy they are. Extra plus is it’s made from recycled material! They do make a tiny squeak sometimes with walking but that is improving daily with wear.

reviews.title: Great show, just too big.
reviews.body: My first thought on this show was its unique design. It looks so cool, is lightweight, but just as durable as other athletic shoes. Unfortunately this shoe was about a size too big, but super comfortable when I tried it on. This shoe is great for men or women, the colors are

reviews.body: The shoes are cute and fit on first try on. After wear, they dug into the back of my ankle and my toes jammed to the front of the shoe. Could have sized up. I did like how breathable they are and they seemed to hold up well!

reviews.title: The (almost) perfect summer shoe!
reviews.body: Comfortable? Yes! Fun but not too flashy? Yes! I feel good about the environmental impact? Double yes! My feet feel suffocated? No! Light and airy? Not quite. Overall I've had a very positive experience with this shoe and have consistently received positive feedback from friends. I wish they were a little more breathable for summer wear... But definitely not a deal breaker. I recommend giving them a try for a fun, comfortable, on trend summer shoe.

The heel is SO big, which is odd for me in a pair of running shoes.  Other than the interesting look, they are comfy, fit true to size and good for the environment (all pluses in my book)!

I was wearing them out and received a compliment from someone of a much younger generation, so they must be cool!  Great product, Nike!  And thank you for making our world a better place for generations to come!

I found them to be a little narrow but I do have a little bit of a wide foot. The design is different than my typical shoe choice but they were comfortable, supportive and lightweight.

title: Nike Space Hippie 01
description: Space Hippie is a story of trash transformed.Combining its airy Space Waste Yarn upper with its ultra-soft Crater foam midsole, the Space Hippie 01 delivers a futuristic look that feels as light as mountain air.The sleek, athletics-inspired silhouette also features an embroidered Swoosh design and unique lacing system that minimise the production process.Made from at least 50% recycled materials, it lets you lace up, salvage your world and live your dreams.

reviews.title: Perfect shoes

I could not believe I had shoes on. I wear a 9 and bought a 9. No gap, big toes NOT hitting top. Awesome shoes. Purchased both colorways.

title: Nike Air Force 1 Luxe
description: The radiance lives on in the Nike Air Force 1 Luxe, the b-ball classic that puts a fresh spin on what you know best. It has stitched overlays, bold colours and the perfect amount of hoops style to make heads turn.

title: Nike Free Run 5.0
description: Made from at least 20% recycled material by weight, the sock-like boot of this Nike Free is designed to transition from running to training to your everyday routine.With a breathable knit upper made from at least 87% recycled material by weight, it combines the flexibility you love with a secure design that will help keep you close to the ground for that barefoot feeling.New cushioning is lighter, softer and more responsive than previous versions so you can keep moving in comfort whether you're on the tarmac or track.

I really like the comfort and support, the shoe cradles the foot, the sole is super flexible. Great shoe, but hey it's a Nike I wouldn't expect anything less! Love the Nike Free series.

reviews.title: Not a running shoe but very nice.

The sole on the shoes are also very squishy but look very cool. They don’t really provide any sort of running benefits due to how light and squishy they are. Definitely more of a casual shoe than a running shoe unlike how they were advertised. If you want real running shoes upgrade to the Pegasus 38 or something more expensive. They are not bad shoes but they have an identity problem.

reviews.title: Love, please don’t change anything about the design.

reviews.body: Fantastic job Nike! I was worried about the tongueless construction because my feet run a touch wide, but Free's are my Jam so I had to give them a try.

reviews.title: Great
reviews.body: I was hyped to see they finally had a new version of the Free RN shoes and bought these right away. They are very comfortable and I like the thin laces. The shoes feel a little spongey which I'm not crazy about (almost feels like wearing slippers) but overall I like them for everyday shoes. I'd buy another pair if there were more colorways.

reviews.title: Nice but needs a little support.
reviews.body: These look awesome, and feel great on your foot. The sole is very soft and minimalist when standing/walking/running. Zero support. I can’t imagine these will take much of a beating, but will probably be fine for daily wear/gym (not on leg day). If you look at the medial (inside) view, you’ll notice the rubber goes thin and narrows on the bottom right at the arch which completely removes any arch support. I’m sure this helps keep them as light, which they are extremely, but I would gladly take the small amount of added weight to get some support. If they had more support these would be 5 star all day.

reviews.title: Useable, fashionable barefoot runners if you have no injuries
reviews.body: These seem to be designed for barefoot in terms of volume and material. The 2021 are like a return to the 2017, a consumer favorite. They're relatively stable, good looking, and have very soft soles. The 2020 had very firm soles, for high stability and ground feel, but Nike returned to soft soles after reviewers widely complained and reported pain despite liking the shoes. Maybe reviewers didn't understand minimalist shoes. I'm eager to see what the 3.0 are like.

reviews.title: OURSTANDING
reviews.body: Love the easy fit. Comfort and technical efficiency. My first run felt like I was floating effortlessly. Besides, they are beautiful!

reviews.title: Free RN
reviews.body: Tremendous fit and comfortable feel. High quality build and materials.
Super comfortable! Just trying to get used to how they look on my feet. They look long and slim on feet. But the comfort is all there !

reviews.title: One of your best shoe lines!
reviews.body: Ok... one of the best limes and silhouettes Nike has! I simply love the Free 5.0!  Lean, light, comfortable and great looking!

reviews.title: Overall great feel and super light.
reviews.body: The soft foam on the bottom comes out the edge a bit more than other shoes but I’ve realized it really helps you feel more connected to the ground providing better turning/cuts and stability. Extremely light feel. I thought the sock-like feel would feel too lose like the fly knit shoes but these feel much more snug and secure. Over extremely happy. I used to own the Free RN 2018 which was my favorite shoe shoe but I think these might surpass it as I wear them more.

title: Nike Air Force 1 GTX
description: The radiance lives on in the Nike Air Force 1 '07 GTX, the b-ball OG that puts a fresh spin on what you know best: crisp leather, bold colours and the perfect amount of flash to make you shine. This time it's clad in GORE-TEX technology.

reviews.title: Smart looking trainers
reviews.body: Bought these on behalf of my son and he loves them. Goretex is definitely a fantastic additional feature.
Highly recommended! Great premium leather! Very comfortable sneaker!

reviews.title: Air Force 1 + Gore-Tex
reviews.body: These shoes are just what the doctor ordered - I now have 2 pairs so am in complete compliance!
Love them

reviews.title: GREAT shoes

reviews.title: Durable
