I really like the shoes but there was glue on the left side of the left one. I don’t have time to send them back but I kind of wish I did.

reviews.title: Superb !

reviews.title: I can’t believe how good they are.
reviews.body: These shoes are incredible. I bought them as my every day casual shoe but they might look too good for that. They’re even better in person. The fly knit has some slight thickness changes which give the illusion of layers like the leather version would have. They look like sweaters for your feet. I can’t believe how good they are.

reviews.title: It's the brown for me
reviews.body: Haven't had a pair of AFs since the mid 90s. These brought me back. Love the Flyknit. Bye bye creases.

Lightest Air Force 1 ever! Also helps with the environment using recycled materials. Overall a great everyday wear.

reviews.title: Walking on AF1
reviews.body: Very comfortable sneaker  ! The AF1 is one of my favorite silhouettes ! Nike knocked it out the park with the design and quality !  The recycled material with the flyknit makes it feel lighter on the foot !  Definitely  one of my favorites so far
Comfortable and looks good.

reviews.title: excellent produit

title: Nike Blazer Mid ’77 Vintage By You
description: The Nike Blazer Mid '77 Vintage By You gets a heritage makeover with innovative corduroy material that you can cut, rip or allow to wear naturally to reveal a wavy, tapestry-like fabric underneath with a character all of its own. Open mesh, classic leather and luscious suede in 13 colours let you switch up your textures and palette. 3 different Swoosh options, including a wraparound version, let you pick your commitment to heritage vibes or 1-of-a-kind style.

title: Nike SB Force 58
description: The latest and greatest innovation to hit the streets, the Nike SB Force 58 gives you the durability of a cupsole with the flexibility of a vulcanised shoe.Made from canvas and suede and finished with perforations, the whole look is infused with heritage basketball DNA.

reviews.title: Love colour

description: The Nike SB Nyjah Free 2 is a sequel worthy of its predecessor. Inspired by the iconic Nike Air Zoom Spiridon, the original rubber design has been updated with mesh panels to help your feet stay cool through your hottest skate sessions.

reviews.title: Awesome
reviews.body: Extremely narrow, you must go a half size up in general. If you have wide or larger feet, probably a full size if that. The comfort is alright, but not the best. The sides rub on my pinky toe quite often so wear comfortable socks. They’re very stylish and go with everything. I mainly use them when lifting because they have a flat bottom, so they are perfect for that. Once they’re slightly broken in they’re fine.

reviews.title: Nyjah crazy cool Haha

reviews.title: Great looking shoe; Not for wider feet.
reviews.body: I love the look of these shoes, but just can't squeeze in to them.  They are way too narrow for me from the ball of the foot to the small toe.  I wear a 9.5, and my foot is 4" across at its widest point.  Based on previous reviews, I'm not sure going a half size up will help.

reviews.title: Only lasts a month or so before starting to come apart

reviews.title: Just Awesome!!

reviews.title: Great shoes!

reviews.title: These shoes will be your favorite on the go shoes, I promise!

When Nyjah pumped out the reveal for these shoes including all the upgrades from the 1's, he really showed us a shoe that had some real firepower behind them. I wore them close to four times a week for a year, and after finally deciding they were needing to be repla

reviews.title: Order half size up
reviews.body: I wear 10.5 in every single shoes and brand (40+ shoes), but had to order half size up on this shoe. Otherwise a great shoe, look great, my new daily shoe.

reviews.title: Nice to buy...twice!
reviews.body: Going back in on these bad boys to purchase them in another color...great value, sleek and clean vibes! Good to ride the board with or just to style around in!

reviews.title: Great shoes at a good price.
reviews.body: Just got these today. Beautiful shoe. I went half a size up since they were sold out of my regular size, and they fit perfectly. Added some custom gel insoles for extra comfort, not that it needed them. Initial impressions are that it’s very sturdy from the toe to heel. Super flexible lining around the ankles, gives full range of motion without feeling restrictive. Nike Free midsole makes them pretty light, while also incorporating the firmness you’d want from a skate shoe. Mesh around the swoosh also makes them super breathable. Overall, definitely worth the money.

reviews.title: Nyjah Houston Shoes are worth every dollar.
reviews.body: These shoes are so comfortable and they are good not just for skateboarding but I play racquetball too and they feel really good on the racquetball court to as well.  This shoe is all around good shoe to have your feet in.  I recommend to anyone that likes their feet to be comfortable.  These are the shoes.

reviews.title: The best.
reviews.body: These are the sickest skate shoes. Have owned about 5 pairs of the Nyjah 2s. Fit like a glove. Extremely comfortable (especially if you add some Footprint insoles). The only issue is that you will wear through the soles of the shoes right where the ball of your popping foot rubs against the grip tape. Wish Nike would use a tougher material for the sole of the shoe. Other than that they are perfect.
Lovely shoe

reviews.title: Coming apart after one week of wear

Nice looking shoe, thats what attracted me in the first place.

reviews.title: Very Narrow compared to other Nike shoes

If they were wider I would keep them but these are just too uncomfortable from the amount of rubbing they do on my pinky toe and start of my big toe. Overall, I really like the design.
We’re cute in the beginning but then the mesh turned yellow on both mine and my husbands sneakers. Wouldn’t buy again

reviews.title: Dope shoe
reviews.body: This shoe is so comfortable. I ordered a half size up (as I do with almost all nikes). If I would’ve ordered my actual size, I would’ve had to return them. I do also have a narrow foot, so these work great. The fit on these remind me of Sambas. I ordered the black/volt swoosh. Clean look. I’m super happy. The shoe is very well fitted and looks really clean.

reviews.title: Very stylish shoes, but you sacrifice flexibility and board feel for incredible durability.
reviews.body: When I tried these shoes on,  they were a bit stiff so thought I would just need to break them in. However it has been over a month now, and while they are better, they still don't give the same flexibility and board control I've come to expect from my skate shoes. Also, while the material is very durable, it is unusual and grips the board much differently than typical skate shoes. It isn't horrible, but it takes getting used to.

reviews.title: Still a great buy I wear them hopefully they break in more
reviews.body: The shoes look great very clean design the only problem ia the material used on the upper toe box and ankle area are too stiff and not very comfortable wish they used softer materials also make a version for wider feet people maybe because they are super narrow

I don’t even skate hard at all, mostly just cruise on a long board or skate half pipes. This shoe is not very durable, seems cheap made, like they pumped it out fast on production and never took time to really make sure the pair I got was put together correctly.

reviews.title: Comfort and Style

reviews.title: Best skate shoe I’ve ever purchased- will be buying more pairs.
reviews.body: Shoe is crazy good for skating. Nike really payed attention to what needed to go into a skate shoe and this is an amazing result. Super, super durable, I’ve skated them extremely hard since the first colorway dropped and they’re still in phenomenal condition. Immediate comfort, no break-in time required

reviews.title: Excellent
reviews.body: Excellent shoe. Fit me perfectly. This shoe is very comfortable and are perfect for skating. Durability wise, I still have to skate in them more but they seem to be holding up just fine.

reviews.title: Great looking shoe, far too narrow
reviews.body: Good looking shoe, but the middle to toe area is very narrow and tight, not good for slightly wider/flatter feet. Sizing Appears to be small rather than true to size.

reviews.title: good shoes
reviews.body: they are good shoes and based on reviews i got them and put a thin layer of shoe goo on the mesh and then went and skated them and after about two hours of skating two of the ghille loops were half way torn through so if you get these put shoe goo on the mesh and two outer ghillie loops , but other then that they are great to skate in.

reviews.title: Great shoe, too skinny
reviews.body: Shoes look great, but way too tight on the inside middle of your foot. I am assuming it won't fit most people

I'm a petite girl so you can imagine how hard it's been to find quality skate shoes in my size, so I am so glad I gave these a shot. They fit perfectly and the board feel is especially on point. I didn't believe that shoes would help my skating experience THAT much, but I get what people mean now. It looks so fire and comfy for just casual shoes, so I'd even recommend to anyone honestly.

reviews.title: Good looking show. Not for wide feet.
reviews.body: Unfortunately I had to return this shoe. I really liked the looks of it but it is too skinny for wide feet. I even tried a half size up, but that did not help. It is a good looking and durable shoe but not made for wide feet.

reviews.title: Still narrow
reviews.body: After having this problem with the 1's I was hoping for some changes. Sadly it seems none have been made. I want to love this shoe but can't. It fits like a peanut. Fine in the heel and toes, very narrow in the arch. You can even see where it bunches up on the instep. Another model, another disappointment.

reviews.title: Way too narrow
reviews.body: So wide through the heel and way too narrow in the toes. Pretty much un-wearable for me.

reviews.title: Great Iteration, but still narrow
reviews.body: I have flat feet, and after hearing Nyjah talk about how these have been made to fit more feet, I decided to give them a shot. They are definitely still on the narrower side for Nike, but they do feel locked in, the grip is good, comfort is good on the board. After breaking in after a few sessions, they feel good, but I definitely treat these like I would soccer cleats - they come off after skating and aren't super comfortable for off-time wear. But that's alright, skate shoes have come a long way and the tech in these is awesome! If you have a flat or wide foot though, be prepared to return it. But Nike has an excellent return policy so definitely skate it for a week and see how it goes!

reviews.title: Solid with Style
reviews.body: Solid and stylish kicks for the urban landscape to add to my rotation. I received my pair in the mail last week and haven't had the time to really put them to the test, but seem thus far seem like a good replacement for my Van Pros once they are really broken-in.

reviews.title: New favorite shoe
reviews.body: Just received these shoes and they are amazing. They fit even better than I was expecting. They are very comfortable  and hold shape well. I am going to get another pair if more colors release.

reviews.title: Coooomfy and loving them already
reviews.body: Ive been skating a bit more during this epidemic on my backyard. and for giggles, decided to try these out. The looks of these shoes are cool as i like red. so the red swoosh was awesome. but yeah, comfortable to skate in, they feel just right. did some kickflips and 360 flips and didnt see any noticable wear after a few days. I use em around the house and walks. really love these shoes. def recommend if they are available again or come in different color ways.

reviews.title: Mesh panneling rips
reviews.body: Nyjah said on his nineclub interview that "extensive testing happened over 2 years" but it seems like these things werent tested, or I just do kickflips different than him.

title: Nike React Tiempo Legend 9 Pro IC
description: One of our lightest Tiempos to date, the Nike React Tiempo Legend 9 Pro IC lets you go on the offensive with a low-profile design that's reinvented for attackers.The upper has raised textures backed by soft foam pods for precise dribbling, passing and shooting, while responsive Nike React cushioning gives you an extra step on your opponent.

title: Nike Air Zoom Pegasus 38
description: A workhorse built to help power you through every mile of the race.The Nike Air Zoom Pegasus 38 continues to put a spring in your step, using the same cushioned support and responsive foam as its predecessor.Mesh in the upper combines the comfort and durability you want with a fit that nods back to the classic Peg.Take a cue from the shoe's throwback design and remember your roots as you take on the road.

reviews.title: Pegasus 38 running shoe
reviews.body: Purchase the Pegasus 38. The shoe meets all the specs provided by Nike. Shoe runs slightly large, I inserted an inter sole and was able to correct the issue. Was afraid to go down 1/2 size because my toe was almost to the end. Believe the issues is that the shoe runs a little wider than other Nike shoes.Shoe is very confortable use it for both low impact cardio and walki

reviews.title: Best Metcon Yet
reviews.body: Pretty much everything I could have asked for in a new Metcon.  More cushion but still super stable.  A much more comfortable upper.  Plenty of room in the toebox. Plus lots of neat and functional little goodies. Oh, and a simple black and white option upon release.  Awesome all the way around.

reviews.title: Not bad
reviews.body: I've not owned any other Metcons, so can't compare, but so far they seem really solid around the heel and they look amazing. My only concern is the rubber sole join at the toe on one of the shoes is already ungluing - for high impact training shoes, I would have expected slightly better than that.

reviews.title: Disappointed with the new metcons.
reviews.body: Disappointed with the new metcons. Having used them since the Metcon 3 i was so excited for these but honestly they were too small in my usually size, felt tight everywhere and not stable at all. Maybe its just me but i love the Metcon 5 and 6 so will just be sticking to them! I guess some people make like these but personally its a no from me! they look lovely and i wanted to love them! Very sad tbh Nike sometimes too much change ruins the shoe i love but im sure many will love them! Personally not for me

reviews.title: Great shoes, let down by cheap decals.
reviews.body: Arrived promptly and they look amazing. However first time at the gym and I lost a few numbers, I did think they were poorly stuck on when the shoe arrived. The shoes themselves are comfy and make a great difference in circuits and S&C.
Really great quality shoe. Very comfortable and great for training.

title: Nike Phantom GT Elite By You
description: Take our most innovative boot to the next level in the Nike Phantom GT Elite By You. After analysing thousands of football-specific moves, a tacky material was added to the Flyknit construction to give you better touch and control of the ball. Add a Dynamic Fit collar for a feel with even more control or go with a low-cut boot; then choose the traction that makes sense for your game.

title: Nike Air Zoom Tempo NEXT%
description: The Nike Air Zoom Tempo NEXT% mixes durability with a design that helps push you towards your personal best. The result is a shoe built like a racer, but made for your everyday training routine.

title: Nike Tiempo Legend 9 Elite FG
description: 1 of our lightest Tiempos to date, the Nike Tiempo Legend 9 Elite FG lets you go on the offensive with a low-profile design that's reinvented for attackers.The upper has raised textures backed by soft foam pods for precise dribbling, passing and shooting, while studs on the bottom provide traction for quick cuts and sudden stops.

reviews.title: Extremely good

Very nice shoe,nice material I love the color I will recommend it to anyone.

reviews.title: You need these!

The traction and feel on the ball is second to none. I have worn a lot of high end boots and these are by far the best. The K leather also shapes to your foot almost immediately. If you’re a fan of the 2000 era uppers then you’ll love

title: Nike ACG Mountain Fly Low
description: Fast, rugged and just as at home in the city as it is in deserts, canyons and mountains, the Nike ACG Mountain Fly Low is ready for whatever you throw at it.The lightweight Ripstop and synthetic upper is durable and airy, while the easy-to-cinch lacing system adds on-the-go personalisation.The sticky rubber outsole brings crag-inspired traction as the soft React foam midsole delivers undisputed comfort whether you're pounding the pavement in the city wilds or leaping rock to rock in Joshua Tree.

title: Nike Air Force 1 '07
description: The radiance lives on in the Nike Air Force 1 '07, the b-ball icon that celebrates 50 years of the Swoosh.Keeping what you know best: stitched overlays, bold colours and the perfect amount of flash to make you shine, it now features a throwback, woven tongue label with original Swoosh and 'nike'.Colour-matched stitching adds to the fun.

title: Nike Victori One
description: You've played hard. You've sweated. You've given your all. Now there's just one last thing—you have to hit the showers. Don't worry, we've got your back with the Nike Victori One. Its one-piece foam design feels soft and comfortable while traction patterns on the sole help with wet surfaces. They dry quickly too, so no one will know you've just stepped out of the showers as you slide up to the party.

reviews.title: Get these instead of the regular Victori One slides.
reviews.body: I have just received this 'shower' version and am very happy. The shower version has the 'band' moulded to the sole, so not expecting tearing, unlike the 'non' shower version; and because the band is a lot thinner than the 'non' shower version, my regular size fits perfect, so not needing a size up. Get these over the 'non' shower version as these fit perfect and do not tear. The most comfortable slides you will ever wear!

reviews.body: Very happy with the delivery service and quality of the shoe. Extremely comfortable and fits great as mentioned. 👌🏿

reviews.title: Great
reviews.body: Love it

reviews.title: Bang for buck it is a pretty good shoe.
reviews.body: Its amazing for the price of it.

reviews.title: Stylish and comfy
reviews.body: Stylish and comfy just as expected.
Excelente, confortable
Happy customer! Fast getting here.

reviews.title: Air Cushion!
reviews.body: Incredible comfort. Feels like walking on a pillow. Very impressed. Was not expecting them to look so good and be this comfortable at this low price. Very Happy!

reviews.title: Extremely Comfortable + Classy
reviews.body: I'm leaving a review because these shoes are underrated.  They are so damn comfortable and walking with perfect posture is a breeze. Nothing beats an all-white shoe when it's first unboxed. #fire

title: Nike Pegasus Trail 3
description: Find your wings with an off-road run.The Nike Pegasus Trail 3 has the same comfort you love, with a design that nods to the classic Pegasus look.Nike React foam delivers responsive cushioning while tough traction helps you stay moving through rocky terrain.More support around the midfoot helps you feel secure on your journey.

reviews.title: Excellent

info.name: D E
info.location: South shields, Tyne and wear, GB

reviews.body: Wanted something for the winter to run and walk the dog normally wear pegasus 38, opted for the trail this winter and so far so good. Running is excellent on trails and road foot feels secure. Will test on long runs soon but happy with purchase. As a diabetic taking care of my feet is important and this trainer fits the bill

reviews.title: Great shoes, needs some breaking in
reviews.body: Great running shoes. Comfortable, stylish and with very good cushioning. Very good trial runners if you stick to dry weather. Compared to the Trail 2 model, I found them to still be true to size but a bit narrower, not enough to be an issue, but enough to be perceived

reviews.title: My favorite running shoe
reviews.body: The pegasus are my favorite running shoes. Very comfortable and responsive. I even got them 5 days ahead of schedule, thanks Nike!

reviews.title: Not a functional pair of shoes for moderate runners.
reviews.body: They look awesome... but the heel is awful! I got a little more than 100 miles in these before the cushioning on the back heel started to clump up, making them unwearable. Very disappointed, because they were otherwise fine trial shoes

reviews.title: Great all-rounder; but could be better
reviews.body: Great shoe; ideal for general running on roads and off-road, but not good at all on wet surfaces.  I read a similar review with some scepticism until I slipped on a wet kerb today.  With a better sole this would be my ideal running shoe

reviews.title: Awesome !
reviews.body: My 15 yr old loves these trainers - second set, great new colour ! Great for all sports but he keeping them for ‘best’ at the moment ! Great product, speedy delivery! All good !

reviews.title: Versatile shoe for walking / hiking / sports
reviews.body: This is a great shoe, perfect for non-specialized cases and a little bit of everything. And Nike was amazing with replacing it with the right fit after I had ordered one size too big and had worn it couple of times. No complaints.

reviews.title: Great shoe overall
reviews.body: I’ve been a lifetime customer / fan of Nike purchasing Nike Shox a remarkable shoe! I was disappointed when learning Shox were discontinued. After searching lots I finally found these Nike Pegasus Trail 3 which seem to come close in comfort. Love the arch support, width and roomy area for toes only wish foam offered more stability. My feet feel like walking on memory foam pillows. Still a great shoe overall!

reviews.title: True to size…stylish
reviews.body: Love these tail shoes…. But to be called real trail they should be waterproof only thing missing, that’s why I give them a 4 star vs 5…..Looking forward to more colors…true to size

reviews.title: Could Be Great without Elastic Band on Tongue
reviews.body: I use to wear my size in the Pegasus.  That's a 9.5.  Then I wore a 10.  Then a 10 Wide.  Then a 10 Extra Wide.  With the Pegasus Trail 3, I wear a 10.5.  If the elastic band on the side of the tongue was removed, this shoe might work for me.  I was going to cut the elastic, but I decided to ask via live chat if it would void the warranty.  Apparently if I altered the shoes, it would void the material(s) covera

reviews.title: Most Comfortable Trail Shoe
reviews.body: I work ten hour shifts and I'm constantly on my feet. Fresh out of the box, these are some of the most comfortable shoes I've ever worn. No break-in period necessary. So far my feet haven't given me the faintest inkling that they might start hurting. You won't regret getting a pair of PT3's. Great job Nike!

reviews.title: 5 star shoe
reviews.body: My dad said these are the best most comfortable shoes he’s ever put on. Thank you Nike!

reviews.title: Sturdy, strong, comfortable.
reviews.body: Sturdy, strong trail shoe. Great fit.

reviews.title: Not a trail shoe
reviews.body: I have the similar 36 trail. Total waste of time unless you run only roads or 100% dry trails. One splash of water and your feet are soaked. May as well be a regular running shoe.

title: Nike Romaleos 4
description: Designed for strength and stability, the Nike Romaleos 4 features a supportive midsole and a wide, flat outsole. Adjustable straps at the midfoot secure your foot during your most intense workouts.

reviews.title: Excellent delivery time and size.
reviews.body: Bought online. Delivered within a week! Fits per size.

reviews.title: True to size, for wide feet too. I’m happy.
reviews.body: Firstly let me say, I’ve used the Legacy Lifters and I wear a 10 for all shoes except converse. Secondly, my feet are wide. My arches aren’t flat and these fit snug but as snug as they’re supposed to. Weightlifting shoes are meant to he worn on the platform and meant to fit snug. While these don’t exactly break in, they do take shape of your feet after a while. Don’t size up or size down. Weightlifting sho

reviews.title: LOVE THESE TRAING SHOES
reviews.body: I bought a black pair last year and I love. Saw this white one and had to have.

reviews.title: Not for people with wide feet.
reviews.body: Great quality shoe for the lifting community. But it is not a great shoe for those with wide feet.

reviews.title: Cool lifting shoes.
reviews.body: I really can't complain with the shoe. The shoes are not heavy. Secure fit with straps. The laces don't stick to the straps and feel very durable. No issues with the toes. I get a lot of compliments (SE model of Romaleos 4). I power clean, deadlift, squat, press, and bench press with no problem. These are shoes specialized for lifting barbells, if you try hard enough you c

reviews.title: Great shoes
reviews.body: Fits true to size, just right. Feels very stable. Great pair!

reviews.title: Amazing stability
reviews.body: Amazing shoes - my PT recommended them to me and as I was new to weightlifting I wasn’t 100% sure it was worth spending the money, but they are so worth it - my stance and squats are rock solid the stability is amazing.

reviews.title: Very well made,true to size
reviews.body: These were bought as a birthday gift that are yet to be used,they do seem to be very well made,a solid shoe,got members discount' so even better

reviews.title: Weight lifting shoes.
reviews.body: Great looking. Functional but toe box way too narrow.

reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.body: I used these for the first time today when doing some heavy squats. I’ve got to say the slight elevation in the heel does the world of good, having being use to lifting with just socks on. The overall look is lovely and they definitely improve my lifts. Can’t wait to try them out more. I am glad I sized up by 0.5 as my usual size wouldn’t have fitted.

reviews.title: Excellent for weightlifting and powerlifting
reviews.body: Amazing. Fit is true to size and they secure the foot perfectly. Solid shoe for lifting. Highly recommend.

reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.body: First squat session in these shoes was amazing , never done so many sets and felt so strong.

reviews.title: Nike Romaleos 4
reviews.body: Very supportive around the mid-foot and toe-box though the toe box is quite narrow until they’re broken in. I have a D width foot. The heel-cup is very sturdy but if you have narrow, skinny heels, they will tend to slide out when you walk, and perhaps on some Olympic lifts or variants.

reviews.title: Romaleus
reviews.body: Definitely take some getting used to but awesome for squatting and cleaning once you figure out the angles that work for you.

reviews.title: Very sleek and stylish
reviews.body: Honestly, all of the Nike shoes I have owned have never been known for their comfort. But this shoe is actually comfortable during my workouts. In terms of aesthetics, Nike typically takes the cake for being sleek and stylish. It has a solid, stable sole with a flexible toe crease perfect for weightlifting. I love the ability to tighten the fit. The only thing is that this shoe runs very small and with a very small toe box. I usually wear men's size 11 and I had to size up to 12 for a good fit with room to splay out my toes during my lifts.

reviews.title: Weightlifting shoes
reviews.body: The style of the shoe looks very sleek and nice. I bought the black ones and I was so excited for them to arrive. I’m a woman’s size 7 and I sized up half a size per the other reviews and I had a lot of heel slip as soon as I started walking. With that being said, I will say they run to size and I would order your usual size if you don’t want any heel slip. I wish Nike would re stock smaller woman sizes especially if they are going to be unisex with their sizes. The shoes were nice, arrived quickly, material looked nice but they don’t have anything smaller than a woman’s 7.5 in the color that I want.

reviews.title: Amazing and true to size
reviews.body: I have had my Romaleo 2s for a decade and love them.  I saw these and decided to get another pair.  I ordered a size 9 which I have worn for years in all shoes despite the reviews of ordering a half size up.  I wore a thin sock and they fit perfectly.  I wore them around the house for a couple of hours and today started a Smolov squat cycle.  They were fantastic!  I recommend these whole heartedly.  I did not experience any heel slip.  True to size was the right call for me.

reviews.title: Highly recommend
reviews.body: Really good training shoe. My first set of OLY shoes and after doing research decided that these were the ones and have not been disappointed. Comfy shoe, fit nicely, feel solid for squats. Only thing I've noticed is a bit of heel slip at times but this is corrected easily with some adjustments of straps and laces.

reviews.title: AWESOME Shoe! Does run small.
reviews.body: The Romaleo 4 is a huge upgrade on the Romaleo 3. I went with the 3s in late 2017 as I was into CrossFit at that time and they were perfect for that. But now I weightlift specifically and the 4s are a much better shoe for out-and-out weightlifting. They feel so much more sturdy. Landing in the catch feels way more supported.
Phenomenal Weightlifting Shoes.

reviews.title: Finally I found a great squat shoe
reviews.body: I read the reviews that these run a half size small, and when I first put them on I thought they were too small. But I did a few squats in them and realized the fit was perfect. Obviously, they aren't for walking in. My squat form was improved right off the bat. These kept me back from my toes. Excellent stability. They run narrow which is what I needed. And they are solidly built.

reviews.title: The Gold Standard
reviews.body: The Nike Romaleos are the gold standard in WL shoes. It's solid, durable, and does what it's supposed to do.  The heel is not too high but juts enough to allow you to get that extra depth.  Its the right balance between the 2s and 3s taking the best of both WL shoes.  I like the Romaleos so much, I own 3 pairs of the 4s.

I have not worked out with them yet, but the sizing is just right. As a woman, this fit like all my other Nikes. I am a 6 across all their sneakers. 4.5 in the kids section. Most of the comments say to size up, but as a woman, I would stick to my normal size.

reviews.title: An amazing weightlifting shoe.
reviews.body: Greatly increased the range of motion in my squats and very comfortable to spend longer sessions in. They're heavier than expected but this works for me as they feel like a more stable base for heavier lifts.

reviews.title: They’re Amazing
reviews.body: I love them!!!!! But they do run a little small make sure you go up a size

reviews.title: Stability and Support.
reviews.body: Overnight difference for squats, cleans and snatches.

reviews.title: runs a little small
reviews.body: heavier than I expected, very stable, runs a little small (which is ideal for wl really)

reviews.title: The very best training shoes out there!
reviews.body: Simply incredible. I’m an elite Powerlifter and have been using these shoes since the Romaleos 2s. Hands down the best in terms of stability and comfort. Love the additional strap over the ankle and think that this is the best training shoe on the market.

reviews.title: Love them!!
reviews.body: Love them! They run smaller than the 3s so returned to go up 1/2 a size

reviews.title: Solid platform, some heel slip. runs 0.5 small
reviews.body: 1. Nice looking weightlifting shoe

reviews.title: This is the cutest shoe ever! But...
reviews.body: I am not a gym shoes person but when I saw this shoe I just had to have it! When I received my shoes in the mail I fell even harder for them and had to get a new outfit of course, but when I put them on I almost cried! They were so narrow and tight on my foot. I wanted to blame it on my Achilles injury not being fully healed but when I tried it on my normal foot it was even tighter. Unfortunately, I will be returning them...
Love the lifters this is my second pair. Wish my first pair had these new and improved laces. And wish both pairs came with extra laces from getting frayed from the straps.

reviews.title: Starting to like these more than my Romaleos 2's
reviews.body: Before making my purchase, I did a lot of homework on these.  Watched all the youtube reviews, reddit threads, forum comments etc.  And I found that most were accurate with sizing.  I normally wear 10.5 and at the time I ordered these, 10 was only available.  I pulled the trigger thinking, I can always return them if they were indeed too small.  I get the lifters in, and at first, they were tight (most reviews did state they ran small).  I have a wide foot but after a few days lifting in them, they stretched out, which mitigated the heel slip issue many have complained of (tying the shoe laces tight and or strapping in the top strap all but eliminates that too btw)

reviews.title: Sizing is wonky, but a major step up from the 3s.
reviews.body: Nike seemed to have finally reclaimed the Romaleos after the disappointing 3s. Not sure they are as good (or better) than the 2s honestly, but so far I'm hopeful. Build, feel, and stability are all very similar to the 2s.

reviews.title: love the way they feel on my feet. just had to go half size bigger.
reviews.body: I bought these with the orange strap. bought a half size larger after researching. fits perfect. I'm used to lighter shoes but these have grown on me so much I wear them all the time. perfectly snug in the front. love them. bought the black and gum also. they were out of my size but two days later they restocked. so happy.

reviews.title: Great
reviews.body: Very satisfied with this product. Would highly recommend!

reviews.title: Great shoe best Support!
reviews.body: Absolutely phenomenal! i had to graduate from the Metcon's. Shoes came and on time they look great! There a little hard to walk to the squat rack in, but when you're there you are planted!  They fit tight and you can make them even tighter, that's what I was expecting. Of course they are a little heavy while you doing leg extensions but that's just the sturdiness. Overall satisfied customer!

reviews.title: Imagine the 2s & a pair of metcons had a baby...
reviews.body: I've owned the 2s and the 3s. The 4s feel stable like the 2s and feel comfy like I was wearing a pair of Metcons.  The only unexpected thing is that they run a bit small.  I'm an 11.5, but these are more snug than what I'm used to with an 11.5. It takes some getting used to, but I have no desire to exchange for a size 12.

reviews.title: Great Shoe...Runs Small.
reviews.body: Great Lifter. Only issue is that it runs small. Ordered 10's and I'm now waiting for 10.5's to come back in stock.

reviews.title: The Reds look more like a fluorescent pink
reviews.body: The shoe itself for strength and stability is perfect. The color does however not match the image for the red variant, so I am disappointed. Overall I'd highly recommend the shoe for the purposes of weightlifting, but I'm going to have to change the color

reviews.title: Heavy weight and runs small
reviews.body: A beautiful looking shoe, but comes up quite small; a whole size too small. It is also a very heavy shoe and feels a little like a Dr. Martin boot to walk in.  I so wanted to love this shoe, especially as its so pretty, but it just wasnt for me.

reviews.title: Go 1/2 size up
reviews.body: LOVE these like I love my 2s!!!!

reviews.title: Coming from the beloved Romaleos 2 to the 4's.
reviews.body: I have a background in powerlifting and I'm an avid Olympic Weightlifter now. I've trained in the Romaleos 2 ever since powerlifting and LOVE that shoe just like everyone else. I won't even mention the Romaleos 3.

reviews.title: Great lifters
reviews.body: Coming from the Romaleo 2s, these feel even better in terms of overall stability and feel, and they are even a bit heavier if you can imagine that!! Initially read reviews to size up 1/2 size from the Rom 2's but after testing TTS and 1/2 size up, TTS ended up being best overall. They WILL break in, and the 1/2 size up ends up being too long and they'll feel a bit like flippers. Overall, definitely worth the price tag!

reviews.title: Well worth it for any serious lifter.
reviews.body: As per tradition, the run narrow so consider that when you order. I ordered a size up from my normal and they fit well. Online you may have read they feel loose in the heel, and I can confirm they somewhat do. At the same time I do not ever feel like it interferes with the lifts or that there is an actual risk of having them come off.

title: Nike React Infinity Run FK 2 Be True
description: This year's Be True collection celebrates pride by honouring LGBTQIA+ communities worldwide.The Nike React Infinity Run FK 2 Be True comes with 9 hook-and-loop flags that represent the multiple communities of gender identities and sexual orientations.Choose what's true to you with bold colours that make a lasting statement.Want more?Click the Product Details link for a little history on each flag.

reviews.body: In love!!! Better than I could have expected! And the little flags for the back..I mean 🥰 amazing.

title: Nike Air Zoom Pegasus 38
description: The road is your runway. Get ready to take flight in the workhorse with wings. Back with extra bounce that's perfect for hitting the tarmac. Whether you're racking up everyday miles or on your long run, feel the spring in your step with the same cushioned support as its predecessor. Breathable mesh in the upper combines the comfort and durability you want with a wider fit at the toes.

reviews.title: This is a great pair of sneakers, but durability is an issue
reviews.body: I purchased this item about a year ago - September 2020, for my primary running shoes. Overall, the experience has been great. Size fits true to size, and the cushioning inside the shoe provides relaxed comfort. Feels very light as well, which is complementary for the purpose of running plus outdoor exercise, such as Tennis in my case. The performance of the shoes was perfect. The only issue I had - and a cri

reviews.title: Disappointed how it has changed from 36
reviews.body: I got this pair to replace my old Pegasus 36.Got disappointed how Nike change overal feel from 36 to 38.The Pegasus 38 has less renponsive and feel, it does run hotter, forefoot feel to soft and dip when I run.Dont get me wrong, these are a great pair of running s
Super produits, fiable et super confortable

reviews.title: I love these shoes
reviews.body: Very nice shoes! Very padded and nice to run in, I would highly recommend

reviews.title: Excellent running shoes
reviews.body: I've just used them for a couple of weeks and they are delightful to wear and run.

reviews.title: Nike has the best products
reviews.body: Nike products are very high quality and they have the best customer service. I recommend their products to anyone.

reviews.title: Pegasus 38
reviews.body: Great running shoe that continues to improve on the always reliable Pegasus series. The fit is perfect with sufficient heel grip and toe box room. I particularly appreciate the ease with which it laces to preferred tightness, and with a well cushioned tongue. The grip is also impressive.

reviews.title: Love the comfort! Disappointed in the quality/longevity.
reviews.body: These shoes fit just right and the comfort is amazing. I use these for walking my dog and an occasional run. However, after only 3 months the toe fabric has started to detach from the sole of the shoe on each foot. The left shoe the entire toe box is detached and the right is well on its way. I’m hoping this is just an anomaly but disappointed in the quality.
Premier run effectué avec et la première impression est top. Chaussures très confortables, bon maintien du pied, bonne réactivité de la semelle. À voir sur le long terme. Ravi de cet achat.
Super comfy love them

reviews.title: Disappointed
reviews.body: Heavy and warm. I totally regret of my purchase, since my previous running shoes were the Pegasus Turbo it's hard to get the same level of comfort and performance. I'll try the Next line and leave the Pegasus to walk my dog. The only good point is the foam sole.

reviews.title: Great Daily Trainer
reviews.body: Absolutely great trainer. I have run in various Pegasus for the last 12 or so years and these are the most comfortable yet. They are perfectly responsive and feel closer to the previous Pegasus Turbo.

reviews.title: Best daily trainer there is
reviews.body: The best daily neutral trainer out there. I’ve tried them all. Good for any easy run, long run, daily run. Durable. Comfortable. I wish the laces were about 2” longer though.

reviews.title: Comfortable
reviews.body: This shoes are extremely comfortable Amd I would recommend

reviews.title: Brilliant running shoes
reviews.body: Comfortable, supportive, breathable. This is about my 5th or 6th pair of Pegasus shoes and they just get better.

reviews.title: Best work shoes I ever owned!
reviews.body: I worked in Stadiums here in LA and im on my feet 12-14 hours a day 4-5 days a week! I broke in the shoes yesterday in a 12hours shift! Oh man....oh man...the most comfortable shoes I own!

reviews.title: 5 Stars
reviews.body: Most comfortable shoes ever. I have plantar fasciitis issues and these shoes prevent my issues. I don’t have to wear my sole inserts with this shoe. Highly recommend!!!!
Very comfy shoe and has great support. It works for speed and for distance. Great shoe.

reviews.title: Excellent all rounder trainer
reviews.body: Really impressed so far. Trainers are a great fit and feel really stable when running.
Too tight. It also has the sides of the tongue attached to the shoe, which defies the purpose of the laces.

reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.body: Perfect fit. Have always loved zombie Pegasus and this is definitely better than the last one.

reviews.title: My favorite Pegasus yet
reviews.body: I have been running w Pegasus shoes for over a decade. The Air Pegasus 38 is by far my favorite shoe yet. Feels lighter, fit is way better. I have a weird toe issue that used to get agitated by earlier versions, but the grommets have been moved and makes these the best running shoes I've worn.

reviews.title: Nice running shoes.
reviews.body: Like the shoes and have been very comfortable

reviews.title: Great daily trainer.
reviews.body: Great daily trainer. Light, lots of cushion. Upper much improved from Pegasus 37, no more heel slip.

reviews.title: Good Running Shoes
reviews.body: These were bought for cross country running shoes. They work great. Very comfortable. They mold to my foot.
Nice fit. Good comfort

reviews.title: Really Nice!!!
reviews.body: Whether training or casual it a great shoe
I'm still a relatively new runner, but these shoes are very comfortable and supportive. I'm able to keep a relatively high volume of running without getting aches and pains. Would recommend
Awesome running shoe with a lot of room in the forefoot.  This shoe is very comfortable and also enjoyable! I will be ordering another pair soon.
We love the shoe and plan to keep them, however, the tongue is unusually narrow and you can see your sock on side. We also tried wide shoe but then was too happy.

reviews.title: My SEVENTH Pegasus -
reviews.body: My history of buying the Pegasus goes back to the "32s." Today my "38s" are exactly what I expected, wanted & needed. At 83, I may not Fly like a Pegasus any more (never did), but the comfort & stability is great & I'm still a happy camper.
I had the shoe for a week and it is already tearing apart at the sole on the medial side. Definitely something I won’t be buying again….really disappointed.

reviews.title: Great price, great running shoe, great Pegs!
reviews.body: I'd previously had Nike Free Runs, Pegasus 36 Trail and Trail 2 trainers over recent years but was excited to see the Peg 38 and how they compare. I wasn't disappointed! Aside from a couple of manufacturing issues that were resolved by Nike swiftly, these are great every day running shoes at a very reasonable price, offering comfort, breathability and much needed bounce for those uphill climbs! I run between 50-75k a week and have put in about 600k in my first pair of Peg 38 so far and thanks to Nike App 4th anniversary birthday have ordered a pair of the BRS Tiger orange colour way at a great discounted price! Next stop later in the year will be the Vaporfly Next% 2 although the price point for those is much higher. Great work Nike!

reviews.title: Comfortable and stylish
reviews.body: I didn't wear Nike sneakers since I was a kid since they seemed to always run too narrow for my feet, however the Pegasus 38 are my favorite sneaker in years. They're extremely comfortable and look great. They're not too narrow and have great cushioning. And I love the fact they sell half sizes.

reviews.title: Great model!
reviews.body: These are the quality that I expect from Pegasus shoes. An improvement from the 37, for sure. Thank you for the return of the cushioned tongue.

reviews.title: Great looking shoe that is very comfortable!
reviews.body: This shoes is sleek and stylish as well as being very comfortable, I am so happy with this purchase.

reviews.title: Pegasus is back!
reviews.body: 38 restores this great shoe to its former standards, tongue is padded, heel counter is cushioned and toe box is deep enough once again.  After struggling through two misguided editions of this style, I am thrilled that Nike fixed the blunders.

reviews.title: Great All-Around Shoe
reviews.body: One of the best everyday running shoes I've worn in a long time. Provides good stability without being too heavy or stiff. Holding up way better after 100+ miles than my Next% shoes are after 30.

reviews.title: sneakers
reviews.body: They are a comfy running shoe. I like them a lot.

reviews.title: Great starter pair or addition to your rotation. Either way, get you a pair.
reviews.body: The Pegasus 38 is a great all around running shoe. It has enough cushion to run nice and easy all day long as well as some spring in the forefoot if you want to do some speed work. They are also stylish enough to wear casually. I got my normal size 11 and they fit true to size. I am very happy to add this to my running shoe rotation. I would recommend this shoe to everyone from new runners to seasoned vets.

reviews.title: Extra wide is everything...
reviews.body: Good sneakers!!

reviews.title: awesome
reviews.body: Comfy, good looking shoe.

reviews.title: Don’t do it keep with the 37 or go half size up😡
reviews.body: Worst peg’s too date, too much cushioning around the tongue, and tight across the top of the foot…..both feet were totally numb on first run out the box.

reviews.title: First Pair of Pegasus
reviews.body: This is my first pair of Pegasus shoes. The build quality and materials are excellent and the shoe is well cushioned (although not overly so). This shoe is quite versatile…the only area I wouldn’t use this shoe would be for track/speed work. The fit is near perfect. The heel area with the split heel counter feels very comfortable and really locks your foot down A+. The mid and forefoot area have adequate space for my feet (which are not particularly wide or narrow). The only area that could use improvement is the medial side of the toe box. It curves in rather quickly and I do get some rubbing on my big toe. The upper is also a touch thick…at least for the summer months. Overall though, a great shoe!

reviews.title: Pegasus Running Shoe-great value
reviews.body: A well cushioned running shoe, stylish, nice motion control and support. Haven't worn Pegasus in awhile. Nice upgrade in material and a great fit.
. The shoe fits well looks good very comfortable

reviews.title: I hated the Pegasus…until….
reviews.body: I absolutely hated the Pegasus 36 & 37. The heel counters were far too rigid which caused slipping, the toe box was incredibly cramped, the midsole was the only saving grace but I just couldn’t over look the other issues. Until now….

reviews.title: Impressed and not tired
reviews.body: My first running shoes and as soon I put them and took the first step they felt different and great. After my first run, my feet and legs were not tired 😳.

reviews.title: Pegasus 38: back on track
reviews.body: This shoe is good to go right out of the box. Nice wide/spacious toe box (unlike the 37), perfect balance of cushion/bounce/responsiveness with the react foam and air unit up front. Overall a great daily road running shoe that can still take on other activities. Looking forward to new colorways soon

reviews.title: Just got them and love them!
reviews.body: Fit very snug, almost too tight at first wear, but once the laces were loosened up they fit great. Very light, perfect in the gym and doing cardio on gym equipment. Will test soon on the street. These replaced my Epic React Flyknits which had taken a beating over the last year.

title: Nike Air Force 1 Low By You
description: The Nike Air Force 1 Low By You became an instant icon after its debut in 1982. Now you can make this classic your own with a colour palette inspired by the '80s and '90s and premium materials including smooth and rippled leather and a new, matching sidewall selection. It's time to create a look that speaks to you.

title: Air Jordan XXXV Low Quai 54
description: Speed brings separation.The Air Jordan XXXV Low has a precise, ultralight feel thanks to an updated Eclipse plate 2.0.Visible Zoom Air helps you run across the floor and take advantage of the space you gain.Details hook to the Quai 54 streetball tournament in Paris.

title: Nike Air Max 95
description: The Nike Air Max 95 "Sakura" is a nod to the rich history of Japan's influence on American fashion and culture.The "Sakura"—or cherry blossom—pattern throughout the shoe adds Japanese-inspired elements to the design.This celebration of cultures also has the same Max Air unit cushioning you know and love, so you can embrace that familiar comfort.

reviews.title: They seem fine......

reviews.title: Authentic and about time too!
reviews.body: These are almost exactly the same as my originals from 95. Subtle pattern addition to the reflective heel is a cool touch.

title: Nike Blazer Mid '77
description: Celebrating visual art and old-school b-ball style, the Nike Blazer Mid '77 features a paint splatter upper that invites you to add your own artistic touch.Or, wear the canvas as-is and turn heads with its 1-of-a-kind design. Topping off the look are a retro Swoosh design and padded collar.

reviews.title: Dope kicks but I hate tongue

title: Nike Air Max Plus
description: Because you should take on every day in a bold way: the Nike Air Max Plus, a Tuned Air experience that offers premium stability and unbelievable cushioning.Plus, these everyday kicks feature durable rubber on the outsole that's designed to give you multi-surface traction.

title: Nike Phantom GT2 Dynamic Fit Elite FG
description: Building off the Phantom GT, the Nike Phantom GT2 Elite FG features an updated design and raised patterning to help create optimal spin to control the flight of the ball.Off-centre lacing provides a clean strike zone for skilful dribbling, passing and shooting.

title: Nike React Infinity Run Flyknit 2 By You
description: The Nike React Infinity Run Flyknit 2 By You continues to help keep you running. A refreshed upper uses Flywire technology that combines with Flyknit for support and breathability where you need it. The high foam heights provide soft responsiveness and long-lasting comfort. It's still one of our most-tested shoes, designed to help you feel the potential when your foot hits the pavement.

title: Nike Air Max 90 By You
description: First a legend on the track and then a legend in the streets, the Nike Air Max 90 By You brings the comfort of Air to the masses. Now you can remake the classic with an all-new colour palette, outsole options and room for a personal message.

title: Nike Air Force 1 '07
description: Radiance lives on in the Nike Air Force 1 '07, the b-ball OG that puts a fresh spin on what you know best: perfectly stitched overlays, bold colours and the perfect amount of flash to make you shine. The new upper contains recycled canvas as well as Flyleather, which is made from at least 50% recycled leather fibre combined with synthetic materials, and features a one-of-a-kind look, letting you celebrate your new future. This product is made from at least 20% recycled materials by weight.

Its a cool shoe and for the price they are a great addition to a rotation of sneakers.

title: LeBron 18 Low x Mimi Plange 'Higher Learning'
description: Unfashion visionary Mimi Plange follows her own rules, creating culture-spanning works that are elegant, expansive and completely unexpected.The LeBron 18 Low 'Higher Learning' is her first sneaker design, inspired by varsity jackets that are a powerful symbol of sport and education.She colours the LeBron 18 Low with unblended shades of mustard, burgundy, pink and crimson, with letterman jacket-like striped ribbing along the sides.The blocky lettering in LeBron's "Just a Kid from Akron" anthem and the spirited lion mascot stand for the primacy of education and the power of sport to transform lives.

reviews.body: The shoes are brilliant, and are comfortable, but definitely buy a size up. I'm a 9 and bought them as a 9 and have to really force to get my feet in; they might stretch over time, but you'll probably do yourself a massive favour by getting a 9.5 for example, or a 10.5 if you're 10, etc, etc.

reviews.title: Great shoe on and off the court
reviews.body: The Nike Lebron XVIII Lo are worth the splurge.

reviews.title: Great shoes
reviews.body: These shoes definitely catch the eye! The bright colors are not for everyone but if you are looking to make a statement then you’ve found your shoe! They were a bit stiff initially but I found they broke in nicely and are fairly comfortable for daily wear for a variety of activities. They seem durable, but time will tell once they get some miles on them and we see how soft the sole is.

reviews.title: Winning style.
reviews.body: Big bold colors. The extra padding around the low ankle takes some time to get used to. I wish they were a little higher rise around the ankle for basketball shoes. Weight of the shoe is fair.

reviews.title: Super Stylish and Comfortable
reviews.body: Let me just start this review by saying that I am by no means a "sneaker head". I like shoes but I'm not a collector. I'm a Dad in my early 30s with 3 kids and I LOVE this sneakers! When I first opened the box the pink and blue just radiate out and they're definitely louder than anything I would normally wear but they're so stylish I immediately fell in love with them. They styling is great, the materials feel durable, and they are very comfortable.

reviews.title: Great shoes for basketball and other activities
reviews.body: These shoes are great for basketball and all sorts of other activities but do not fit me well enough to be worn daily for long periods of time.

reviews.title: Amazingly Supportive and Stylish Shoe
reviews.body: Right out of the box I was incredibly impressed with the attractive new Nike Lebron XVIII Lo. The fit was ever so slightly short, but very close to my usual size and the feel is incredible - supportive without being stiff. The Nike Lebron XVIII Lo will easily carry you through long days on and off the court as it is amazingly supportive. Although not quite my style, the color is eye-catching and vibrant. I also like that this lo has more of the styling of a mid top basketball shoe. My favorite aspect of the Nike Lebron XVIII Lo would have to be the superior ankle support. The only thing I might change would be the color options, but overall an excellent basketball shoe.

reviews.title: Love the durability
reviews.body: My husband typically wears a 10.5 so that’s the size we went with. He said they felt really tight but after a few wears they grew on him more, which is why the rating is 4 versus 5. The perfect shoe on first wear would feel great.

reviews.title: Great Arch Support, Great Design, Runs Small, Tight at the Ankle
reviews.body: When I pulled these shoes out of the box, I immediately thought "these are men's sneakers that make you look at them." I know if I saw some guys running up and  down the court, these are the sneakers I would be following. The color draws the eye. I did find the thick blue heel to be a bit much for me (although it does appear to provide more spring in my jump). They are bolder than I, as a woman with larger feet who always wants to downplay that feature, would typically go for. The black around the edge helped minimize the size issue for me though. If you are looking to make a statement with your sneakers, these fit the bill.

reviews.title: Average Shoe
reviews.body: I thought the shoe was fairly comfortable and provided good support.  My one complaint about how it felt was that it seemed a little tight width wise in the toes, but then would get more comfortable as I continued to wear. I did like the padding in the back.

reviews.title: Good support
reviews.body: These shoes have great support around the ankles with cushion to make it comfortable. They did fit a little snug, but I know shoes differ from brand to brand. The color and style are on point and everybody looks! Sure to make a statement.

reviews.title: Overall all loved the design.
reviews.body: I've gotten several compliments ☺, and I never get compliments on my shoes.  They're tight at first I'd say it takes like 2 days till worn in. Once they are though it's like I'm walking on pillows.

reviews.title: Shoe looks the part, but might not be comfortable for everyone!
reviews.body: I was excited to get these shoes, as previous shoes have been great!  These looked great, with some really bold colours and design.  I was a little put off by the height of the clear cushion area at the heel, but they looked much better once I was wearing them and could view them from above.  My bodyweight probably helped squash them down slightly too.

reviews.title: Comfort and style on the court
reviews.body: As soon as I put on the shoe, I felt the NIke React system in the forefoot immediately. It is very soft and provides a lot of protection against impact and worked well with the compression and impact resistance in the heel.

reviews.title: I Got Next
reviews.body: Once I put on the Nike Lebron XVIII Lo's I'm ready for the court. The first thing I notice is they are snug on my feet, and this is a must when I'm hooping. They're considered a lo, but they feel more like a mid. When I start running and cutting the Lebron's handle as well as I would expect from  any high end basketball shoe. I normally wear a 10 but, these run small so I would definitely size up. Another great feature especially after running 2 or 3 games, is that the thin  mesh on the sides of the shoe make them very breathable.  But by far my favorite part of the shoe (see picture) is the memory form support on the back side of your ankle. This form support cradles your ankles as your breaking ankles on the court. I would definitely recommend these shoes if your in the market for some new basketball shoes.

reviews.title: Can't miss me in my new kicks!
reviews.body: The Nike LeBron XVIII Lo is a bright shoe! It is Hot pink, Light blue and black and it is beautiful! It is definitely a shoe that grows on you. When it was first taken out of the box, the bright colors made me pause but after a while they grew on me and now I LOVE them. Also the shoe is SUPER comfortable! It does run narrow and would have gotten a half size bigger if I would have known.  But even though my pinky toes were a little uncomfortable the overall comfort of the shoe sort of made up for it. The inside of the shoe is like walking on a soft mattress and the shoe absorbs a lot of the impact. The shoe is a high back shoe and even though I usually don't like them, the shoe was comfortable and it didn't bother me at all. Because the shoe was a little narrow and my pinky toes were feeling the brunt of it, I couldn't wear it for more than a few hours but if the size was correct, this is the type of shoe that I could totally wear all day long. If I could change anything, it would be the narrowness towards the front. This would solve the size issue! Besides that, I LOVE this shoe and it's my new go to from  walking the hills around my house to taking family pictures

reviews.title: Great style, super comfortable, just runs small size wise
reviews.body: These shoes are amazing!! So much support in the ankle and arches, and there’s even a little extra cushion around the heals for more comfort and support. These have great bounce and movement, and are snug, but uncomfortably so. I would have given them 5 stars, but they actually don’t fit me right. I would have needed to size up at least a half size, maybe even a full size. I can wear them, they’re just a little too tight and my toes are squished in the end. Keep that in mind if you’re ordering. Size up at least a half size! Overall, these are amazing kicks and my wife loves them since they do fit her. She’s about a size 10 in women, and these are 11’s. Something to think about! I highly recommend, though. The colors are vibrant and so much better in person!

reviews.title: Style Meets Performance.
reviews.body: The last time I owned a pair of basketball shoes was the Nike Lebron Zoom Solider VII. I was excited to test out how much the technology and design have changed since then. I normally wear a men’s size 9 and these shoes were true to size for me. They were easy and comfortable to put on. If you have wider feet, I’d recommend getting a half to full size up.

reviews.title: Most supportive shoe I have.
reviews.body: I have never had a shoe with this much support! I could wear these shoes all day, or I could play some ball in them and not worry about being uncomfortable. It feels like they give you and extra spring in your step. I honestly think my vertical jump is better with these shoes and I feel less fatigue. They also have tremendous grip so you don’t slip and slide all over the place. They feel very durable so I should get a lot of use out of them. My favorite part of these shoes is the support and comfort I feel in them. I can’t wait to put these shoes to the test and see how long they hold up. I think they will last a long time!

title: Nike React Tiempo Legend 9 Pro TF

title: Air Jordan XXXVI SE 'Glory'

reviews.title: Tight Around Ball of Foot Area...Size up
reviews.body: These shoes look great, but are sadly pretty tight around the ball of the foot and across. I loosened the laces to see if that would help, but it didn't help nearly as much as I'd hoped. I had hoped that all I needed was to wear them a couple times and they'd stretch out, but it's already been a couple days and it still feels pretty uncomfortable around the same area.  I bought them in the Malt/Desert Sand color to be a little different, but pretty disappointed at the overall fit. The shoes look great, but you will probably need to size up.

reviews.title: Took longer than usual to rip
reviews.body: These just didn't want to rip! Usually I bust through shoes in about a month. I mainly skate flatground throughout the week and hit up a skatepark on the weekend. I kickflip and heelflip over and over so I'm usually hitting holes in 2 weeks in other shoes and then out comes the shoe goo. (I heelflip with my toes all the way on the board almost like an ollie) It took me a month to just get a hole in these! I ripped the top and bottom lace in these but that was it even with the lace saver option. Immediately bought another pair and shoe gooed the ones I have on hand cause once broken in these things are magical and I don't want to skate another shoe. Besides maybe some SB dunks but whos getting their hands on them these days anyways. Which by the way Nike can we can we get a non hype SB dunks for us skaters pleeeeasseeeeee?
Loved it

reviews.title: The Shane vs Janoski review you've all been waiting for...
reviews.body: You only really need to know how these stack up against Janoski's, right? Well here it is: The initial fit is slightly less restrictive in width, which I always found a bit tight with Janoskis. The support in general is very similar, making your foot feel snug, but still low profile enough to get amazing board feel. The shape of the toe is a bit rounder, which might not be to everyone's taste in terms of flick for board control, but I've come to love it. The lace hoops keep everything locked in for as long as possible, and overall they skate really nice after a few days breaking in. They're not going to last for ages, and they're not going to be able to skate straight away, but there you go.

The color (a pinkish-red) is bolder than I would normally choose, though I don't think it is distracting or over-the-top. With jeans, they're ideal for running errands and heading to work.

reviews.title: Nice Design
reviews.body: The design of these shoes are very cool. I love the mesh and how they allow for some cooling. They are also pretty light overall and the soles have some nice bounce. They were good for running and I felt no discomfort during my daily run.

reviews.title: Great Casual Shoe
reviews.body: I was pleasantly surprised with these shoes. They look more like casual shoes than running or walking shoes but I really like the way they look! When I first put them on, I was worried they would be uncomfortable, but once I started walking in them, they were just fine. The backs are higher up, so taller socks are necessary to avoid blisters. I also love that these are made from recycled material.

reviews.title: Breathable and Lightweight
reviews.body: These are great sneakers for everyday wear. They are lightweight (probably the most lightweight shoes I’ve ever had) breathable, and my feet are comfortable and not sweaty after wearing them all day. They are stylish without being too over the top. I personally prefer shoes without much arch support and these are perfect for me. True to size.  I wish the laces were a little longer but not a deal breaker and I am definitely  to look for these in different colors to add to my collection.

reviews.title: Well-made and stylish
reviews.body: The Waffle One Crater running shoes immediately impressed me out of the box with Nike's commitment to using recycled materials. You will notice this in the design of the rubber sole which are speckled. The tops are lightweight and are easy to put on. I like that they don't weigh down my feet. The fabric is translucent in some areas, so they pair well with fun socks. I'm a dad, and I feel this shoe fits my lifestyle running after kids without making me feel like I'm in a "dad shoe." The fit is snug and comfortable. I have good support in these and didn't feel like I was dying to take them off at the end of the day. My favorite part of them is their look and comfort. I like how lightweight they are, but I could go for a thicker tongue and the thin fabric on the top crinkles a bit by my toes. I'm mostly worried about their durability as my kids step on my feet or roll their bikes over them or any other wear and tear. They ran big for me, so that could've lap contributed to the crinkling of fabric near my toes.

reviews.title: Awesome summer sneaker!
reviews.body: These shoes are great, especially on hot summer days!

reviews.title: New pair of awesome dad shoes
reviews.body: I am really happy with these sneakers!! They're comfortable, breathable, and lightweight!! I am happy to say that they go with a lot of my wardrobe, and have been able to wear them with every outfit I wanted since I got them. The design is very cool, almost like a retro look. They fit a little small, but are very comfortable, and I have worn them all day for several days with no issues. I wouldn't change anything about these shoes, and like the versatility of the style and colors.

reviews.title: Love the recycled material
reviews.body: I love that the shoes are made of recycled material! My favorite part of the shoe is the mesh sides. It really keeps my feet cool in the summer heat. The cushion of the shoe is great and makes them very comfortable to wear all day long. I like to wear them for running as well and around during the day. The tongue of the shoe is so soft and comfortable. It is thinner and sits very nicely on my foot when laced up. Overall, these are a great pair of shoes!

reviews.title: LIGHT AND COMFORTABLE
reviews.body: These shoes are absolutely amazing they were so comfortable,light and had great traction. I wore them all day while running errands to break them in and they were so comfortable and had great heel support with good cushion. The neutral color with a nice orangish front  gives it a little pop of color making it easy to wear with almost anything. Went for a walk and jog and I felt like I was on clouds . The shoe is thin and has a screen on the side which allows air into every step making sure your feet don't get extremely sweaty which I really loved. They are also made with 20% recycled product! I really enjoy walking, jogging and running in my new running shoes.

reviews.title: Love these shoes
reviews.body: I consider myself to be pretty picky when it comes to my shoes. These ones fit the bill. I love the breathable mesh, it makes walking more comfortable. The material is soft enough that they don’t irritate my heels at all. The bottoms have good traction which works for all types of ground. I wear them on walks or just all day casual wear and my feet have yet to hurt. I really enjoy the neutral look they have which goes with basically anything I wear. 10/10 recommend.

reviews.title: So far so good!
reviews.body: Just received these shoes and they are really comfortable. They look great but do run big in sizing. I would wear these for casual shoes more so than for athletic purposes or running.

reviews.title: Breathable and Comfy!
reviews.body: I’m on my feet all day, and from the moment I put these on I felt they were very comfortable. They felt lightweight and supportive, and I noticed the mesh areas that really allowed fir a comfortable all day wear, even during this summer heat wave. I loved the details on this shoe; it’s artistic but subtle. I’ve never felt a sneaker as airy as this one! Usually I expect to have hot feet, but these are otherworldly. I highly recommend these for casual errand runs,  outdoor activities, the gym and anytime you don’t want to think about your feet being uncomfortable. Great job, Nike!

title: Nike ACG Air Mowabb
description: Celebrate the great outdoors and get your feet dirty in the Nike ACG Air Mowabb.Celebrating its 30th year, the legendary hiking design gives you the advantage of comfy Air underfoot, supportive Huarache technology around the heel and a speckled midsole to deliver unmistakable comfort and style.Soft nubuck leather in the upper adds durability while the stretchy collar personalises the fit.Lace up and get to your next adventure.

title: Nike Mercurial Superfly 8 Academy IC
description: The Nike Mercurial Superfly 8 Academy IC sets you up for speed with specialised traction designed for the court or street.Grippy texture on top gives you precise control of the ball, and a stretchy collar creates a seamless fit that moves with you.

title: Nike ACG Mountain Fly Low
description: This is nothing like the shoes your parents used to hike in.Just as at home in the city as it is in deserts, canyons and on mountains, the Nike ACG Mountain Fly Low is ready for whatever you throw at it.It uses a sticky rubber outsole that brings crag-inspired traction.Soft React foam in the midsole delivers comfort whether you're walking down the street or scrambling in the hills.

title: Nike Phantom GT2 Pro FG

title: Nike Space Hippie 04
description: Space Hippie is a story of trash transformed. From the upper to the outsole, at least 25% of the Space Hippie 04 is made from recycled material, by weight. Not only is it the most lightweight silhouette within the collection, it also has the lowest carbon footprint. Its 'Space Waste Yarn' upper includes about 75% recycled content, by weight, made from recycled plastic bottles, T-Shirts and yarn scraps. A soft, Crater Foam midsole combines Nike grind with a blend of foams for stability and a unique aesthetic.

I would not want to run or even walk long distances in these shoes.

The wide, padded strap feels as good as it looks.
